               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Is love a tender thing? it is too rough,</div>
                     <div class="line">Too rude, too boisterous, and it pricks like thorn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MERCUTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">If love be rough with you, be rough with love;</div>
                     <div class="line">Prick love for pricking, and you beat love down.</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me a case to put my visage in:</div>
                     <div class="line">A visor for a visor! what care I</div>
                     <div class="line">What curious eye doth quote deformities?</div>
                     <div class="line">Here are the beetle brows shall blush for me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, knock and enter; and no sooner in,</div>
                     <div class="line">But every man betake him to his legs.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">A torch for me: let wantons light of heart</div>
                     <div class="line">Tickle the senseless rushes with their heels,</div>
                     <div class="line">For I am proverb'd with a grandsire phrase;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll be a candle-holder, and look on.</div>
                     <div class="line">The game was ne'er so fair, and I am done.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MERCUTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Tut, dun's the mouse, the constable's own word:</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou art dun, we'll draw thee from the mire</div>
                     <div class="line">Of this sir-reverence love, wherein thou stick'st</div>
                     <div class="line">Up to the ears. Come, we burn daylight, ho!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, that's not so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MERCUTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I mean, sir, in delay</div>
                     <div class="line">We waste our lights in vain, like lamps by day.</div>
                     <div class="line">Take our good meaning, for our judgment sits</div>
                     <div class="line">Five times in that ere once in our five wits.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">And we mean well in going to this mask;</div>
                     <div class="line">But 'tis no wit to go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MERCUTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, may one ask?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">I dream'd a dream to-night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MERCUTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">And so did I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, what was yours?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MERCUTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">That dreamers often lie.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">In bed asleep, while they do dream things true.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MERCUTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">O, then, I see Queen Mab hath been with you.</div>
                     <div class="line">She is the fairies' midwife, and she comes</div>
                     <div class="line">In shape no bigger than an agate-stone</div>
                     <div class="line">On the fore-finger of an alderman,</div>
                     <div class="line">Drawn with a team of little atomies</div>
                     <div class="line">Athwart men's noses as they lie asleep;</div>
                     <div class="line">Her wagon-spokes made of long spiders' legs,</div>
                     <div class="line">The cover of the wings of grasshoppers,</div>
                     <div class="line">The traces of the smallest spider's web,</div>
                     <div class="line">The collars of the moonshine's watery beams,</div>
                     <div class="line">Her whip of cricket's bone, the lash of film,</div>
                     <div class="line">Her wagoner a small grey-coated gnat,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not so big as a round little worm</div>
                     <div class="line">Prick'd from the lazy finger of a maid;</div>
                     <div class="line">Her chariot is an empty hazel-nut</div>
                     <div class="line">Made by the joiner squirrel or old grub,</div>
                     <div class="line">Time out o' mind the fairies' coachmakers.</div>
                     <div class="line">And in this state she gallops night by night</div>
                     <div class="line">Through lovers' brains, and then they dream of love;</div>
                     <div class="line">O'er courtiers' knees, that dream on court'sies straight,</div>
                     <div class="line">O'er lawyers' fingers, who straight dream on fees,</div>
                     <div class="line">O'er ladies ' lips, who straight on kisses dream,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which oft the angry Mab with blisters plagues,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because their breaths with sweetmeats tainted are:</div>
                     <div class="line">Sometime she gallops o'er a courtier's nose,</div>
                     <div class="line">And then dreams he of smelling out a suit;</div>
                     <div class="line">And sometime comes she with a tithe-pig's tail</div>
                     <div class="line">Tickling a parson's nose as a' lies asleep,</div>
                     <div class="line">Then dreams, he of another benefice:</div>
                     <div class="line">Sometime she driveth o'er a soldier's neck,</div>
                     <div class="line">And then dreams he of cutting foreign throats,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of breaches, ambuscadoes, Spanish blades,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of healths five-fathom deep; and then anon</div>
                     <div class="line">Drums in his ear, at which he starts and wakes,</div>
                     <div class="line">And being thus frighted swears a prayer or two</div>
                     <div class="line">And sleeps again. This is that very Mab</div>
                     <div class="line">That plats the manes of horses in the night,</div>
                     <div class="line">And bakes the elflocks in foul sluttish hairs,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which once untangled, much misfortune bodes:</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the hag, when maids lie on their backs,</div>
                     <div class="line">That presses them and learns them first to bear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Making them women of good carriage:</div>
                     <div class="line">This is she--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, peace, Mercutio, peace!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou talk'st of nothing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MERCUTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">True, I talk of dreams,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which are the children of an idle brain,</div>
                     <div class="line">Begot of nothing but vain fantasy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which is as thin of substance as the air</div>
                     <div class="line">And more inconstant than the wind, who wooes</div>
                     <div class="line">Even now the frozen bosom of the north,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, being anger'd, puffs away from thence,</div>
                     <div class="line">Turning his face to the dew-dropping south.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">This wind, you talk of, blows us from ourselves;</div>
                     <div class="line">Supper is done, and we shall come too late.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">I fear, too early: for my mind misgives</div>
                     <div class="line">Some consequence yet hanging in the stars</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall bitterly begin his fearful date</div>
                     <div class="line">With this night's revels and expire the term</div>
                     <div class="line">Of a despised life closed in my breast</div>
                     <div class="line">By some vile forfeit of untimely death.</div>
                     <div class="line">But He, that hath the steerage of my course,</div>
                     <div class="line">Direct my sail! On, lusty gentlemen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Strike, drum.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.7">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>6. SCENE V.  A hall in Capulet's house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Musicians waiting. Enter Servingmen with napkins</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Where's Potpan, that he helps not to take away? He</div>
                     <div class="line">shift a trencher? he scrape a trencher!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">When good manners shall lie all in one or two men's</div>
                     <div class="line">hands and they unwashed too, 'tis a foul thing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Away with the joint-stools, remove the</div>
                     <div class="line">court-cupboard, look to the plate. Good thou, save</div>
                     <div class="line">me a piece of marchpane; and, as thou lovest me, let</div>
                     <div class="line">the porter let in Susan Grindstone and Nell.</div>
                     <div class="line">Antony, and Potpan!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, boy, ready.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">You are looked for and called for, asked for and</div>
                     <div class="line">sought for, in the great chamber.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">We cannot be here and there too. Cheerly, boys; be</div>
                     <div class="line">brisk awhile, and the longer liver take all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CAPULET, with JULIET and others of his house,
meeting the Guests and Maskers</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Welcome, gentlemen! ladies that have their toes</div>
                     <div class="line">Unplagued with corns will have a bout with you.</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah ha, my mistresses! which of you all</div>
                     <div class="line">Will now deny to dance? she that makes dainty,</div>
                     <div class="line">She, I'll swear, hath corns; am I come near ye now?</div>
                     <div class="line">Welcome, gentlemen! I have seen the day</div>
                     <div class="line">That I have worn a visor and could tell</div>
                     <div class="line">A whispering tale in a fair lady's ear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Such as would please: 'tis gone, 'tis gone, 'tis gone:</div>
                     <div class="line">You are welcome, gentlemen! come, musicians, play.</div>
                     <div class="line">A hall, a hall! give room! and foot it, girls.</div>
                     <p>Music plays, and they dance</p>
                     <div class="line">More light, you knaves; and turn the tables up,</div>
                     <div class="line">And quench the fire, the room is grown too hot.</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, sirrah, this unlook'd-for sport comes well.</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, sit, nay, sit, good cousin Capulet;</div>
                     <div class="line">For you and I are past our dancing days:</div>
                     <div class="line">How long is't now since last yourself and I</div>
                     <div class="line">Were in a mask?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Capulet</div>
                     <div class="line">By'r lady, thirty years.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">What, man! 'tis not so much, 'tis not so much:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis since the nuptials of Lucentio,</div>
                     <div class="line">Come pentecost as quickly as it will,</div>
                     <div class="line">Some five and twenty years; and then we mask'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Capulet</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis more, 'tis more, his son is elder, sir;</div>
                     <div class="line">His son is thirty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you tell me that?</div>
                     <div class="line">His son was but a ward two years ago.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>To a Servingman</span>  What lady is that, which doth</div>
                     <div class="line">enrich the hand</div>
                     <div class="line">Of yonder knight?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">I know not, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">O, she doth teach the torches to burn bright!</div>
                     <div class="line">It seems she hangs upon the cheek of night</div>
                     <div class="line">Like a rich jewel in an Ethiope's ear;</div>
                     <div class="line">Beauty too rich for use, for earth too dear!</div>
                     <div class="line">So shows a snowy dove trooping with crows,</div>
                     <div class="line">As yonder lady o'er her fellows shows.</div>
                     <div class="line">The measure done, I'll watch her place of stand,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, touching hers, make blessed my rude hand.</div>
                     <div class="line">Did my heart love till now? forswear it, sight!</div>
                     <div class="line">For I ne'er saw true beauty till this night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TYBALT</div>
                     <div class="line">This, by his voice, should be a Montague.</div>
                     <div class="line">Fetch me my rapier, boy. What dares the slave</div>
                     <div class="line">Come hither, cover'd with an antic face,</div>
                     <div class="line">To fleer and scorn at our solemnity?</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, by the stock and honour of my kin,</div>
                     <div class="line">To strike him dead, I hold it not a sin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, how now, kinsman! wherefore storm you so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TYBALT</div>
                     <div class="line">Uncle, this is a Montague, our foe,</div>
                     <div class="line">A villain that is hither come in spite,</div>
                     <div class="line">To scorn at our solemnity this night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Young Romeo is it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TYBALT</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis he, that villain Romeo.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Content thee, gentle coz, let him alone;</div>
                     <div class="line">He bears him like a portly gentleman;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, to say truth, Verona brags of him</div>
                     <div class="line">To be a virtuous and well-govern'd youth:</div>
                     <div class="line">I would not for the wealth of all the town</div>
                     <div class="line">Here in my house do him disparagement:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore be patient, take no note of him:</div>
                     <div class="line">It is my will, the which if thou respect,</div>
                     <div class="line">Show a fair presence and put off these frowns,</div>
                     <div class="line">And ill-beseeming semblance for a feast.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TYBALT</div>
                     <div class="line">It fits, when such a villain is a guest:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll not endure him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">He shall be endured:</div>
                     <div class="line">What, goodman boy! I say, he shall: go to;</div>
                     <div class="line">Am I the master here, or you? go to.</div>
                     <div class="line">You'll not endure him! God shall mend my soul!</div>
                     <div class="line">You'll make a mutiny among my guests!</div>
                     <div class="line">You will set cock-a-hoop! you'll be the man!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TYBALT</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, uncle, 'tis a shame.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to, go to;</div>
                     <div class="line">You are a saucy boy: is't so, indeed?</div>
                     <div class="line">This trick may chance to scathe you, I know what:</div>
                     <div class="line">You must contrary me! marry, 'tis time.</div>
                     <div class="line">Well said, my hearts! You are a princox; go:</div>
                     <div class="line">Be quiet, or--More light, more light! For shame!</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll make you quiet. What, cheerly, my hearts!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TYBALT</div>
                     <div class="line">Patience perforce with wilful choler meeting</div>
                     <div class="line">Makes my flesh tremble in their different greeting.</div>
                     <div class="line">I will withdraw: but this intrusion shall</div>
                     <div class="line">Now seeming sweet convert to bitter gall.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>To JULIET</span>  If I profane with my unworthiest hand</div>
                     <div class="line">This holy shrine, the gentle fine is this:</div>
                     <div class="line">My lips, two blushing pilgrims, ready stand</div>
                     <div class="line">To smooth that rough touch with a tender kiss.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Good pilgrim, you do wrong your hand too much,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which mannerly devotion shows in this;</div>
                     <div class="line">For saints have hands that pilgrims' hands do touch,</div>
                     <div class="line">And palm to palm is holy palmers' kiss.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Have not saints lips, and holy palmers too?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, pilgrim, lips that they must use in prayer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">O, then, dear saint, let lips do what hands do;</div>
                     <div class="line">They pray, grant thou, lest faith turn to despair.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Saints do not move, though grant for prayers' sake.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Then move not, while my prayer's effect I take.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus from my lips, by yours, my sin is purged.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Then have my lips the sin that they have took.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sin from thy lips? O trespass sweetly urged!</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me my sin again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">You kiss by the book.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, your mother craves a word with you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">What is her mother?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, bachelor,</div>
                     <div class="line">Her mother is the lady of the house,</div>
                     <div class="line">And a good lady, and a wise and virtuous</div>
                     <div class="line">I nursed her daughter, that you talk'd withal;</div>
                     <div class="line">I tell you, he that can lay hold of her</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall have the chinks.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Is she a Capulet?</div>
                     <div class="line">O dear account! my life is my foe's debt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Away, begone; the sport is at the best.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, so I fear; the more is my unrest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, gentlemen, prepare not to be gone;</div>
                     <div class="line">We have a trifling foolish banquet towards.</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it e'en so? why, then, I thank you all</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank you, honest gentlemen; good night.</div>
                     <div class="line">More torches here! Come on then, let's to bed.</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, sirrah, by my fay, it waxes late:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll to my rest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt all but JULIET and Nurse</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Come hither, nurse. What is yond gentleman?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">The son and heir of old Tiberio.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">What's he that now is going out of door?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, that, I think, be young Petrucio.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">What's he that follows there, that would not dance?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">I know not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Go ask his name: if he be married.</div>
                     <div class="line">My grave is like to be my wedding bed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">His name is Romeo, and a Montague;</div>
                     <div class="line">The only son of your great enemy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">My only love sprung from my only hate!</div>
                     <div class="line">Too early seen unknown, and known too late!</div>
                     <div class="line">Prodigious birth of love it is to me,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I must love a loathed enemy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">What's this? what's this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">A rhyme I learn'd even now</div>
                     <div class="line">Of one I danced withal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>One calls within 'Juliet.'</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">Anon, anon!</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, let's away; the strangers all are gone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.4">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 2. ACT II</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. PROLOGUE</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE I.  A lane by the wall of Capulet's orchard.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.4">3. SCENE II.  Capulet's orchard.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.5">4. SCENE III.  Friar Laurence's cell.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.6">5. SCENE IV.  A street.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.7">6. SCENE V.  Capulet's orchard.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.8">7. SCENE VI.  Friar Laurence's cell.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. PROLOGUE</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Chorus</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Chorus</div>
                     <div class="line">Now old desire doth in his death-bed lie,</div>
                     <div class="line">And young affection gapes to be his heir;</div>
                     <div class="line">That fair for which love groan'd for and would die,</div>
                     <div class="line">With tender Juliet match'd, is now not fair.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now Romeo is beloved and loves again,</div>
                     <div class="line">Alike betwitched by the charm of looks,</div>
                     <div class="line">But to his foe supposed he must complain,</div>
                     <div class="line">And she steal love's sweet bait from fearful hooks:</div>
                     <div class="line">Being held a foe, he may not have access</div>
                     <div class="line">To breathe such vows as lovers use to swear;</div>
                     <div class="line">And she as much in love, her means much less</div>
                     <div class="line">To meet her new-beloved any where:</div>
                     <div class="line">But passion lends them power, time means, to meet</div>
                     <div class="line">Tempering extremities with extreme sweet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE I.  A lane by the wall of Capulet's orchard.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ROMEO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Can I go forward when my heart is here?</div>
                     <div class="line">Turn back, dull earth, and find thy centre out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>He climbs the wall, and leaps down within it</p>
               <p>Enter BENVOLIO and MERCUTIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Romeo! my cousin Romeo!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MERCUTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">He is wise;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, on my lie, hath stol'n him home to bed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">He ran this way, and leap'd this orchard wall:</div>
                     <div class="line">Call, good Mercutio.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MERCUTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, I'll conjure too.</div>
                     <div class="line">Romeo! humours! madman! passion! lover!</div>
                     <div class="line">Appear thou in the likeness of a sigh:</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak but one rhyme, and I am satisfied;</div>
                     <div class="line">Cry but 'Ay me!' pronounce but 'love' and 'dove;'</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak to my gossip Venus one fair word,</div>
                     <div class="line">One nick-name for her purblind son and heir,</div>
                     <div class="line">Young Adam Cupid, he that shot so trim,</div>
                     <div class="line">When King Cophetua loved the beggar-maid!</div>
                     <div class="line">He heareth not, he stirreth not, he moveth not;</div>
                     <div class="line">The ape is dead, and I must conjure him.</div>
                     <div class="line">I conjure thee by Rosaline's bright eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">By her high forehead and her scarlet lip,</div>
                     <div class="line">By her fine foot, straight leg and quivering thigh</div>
                     <div class="line">And the demesnes that there adjacent lie,</div>
                     <div class="line">That in thy likeness thou appear to us!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">And if he hear thee, thou wilt anger him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MERCUTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">This cannot anger him: 'twould anger him</div>
                     <div class="line">To raise a spirit in his mistress' circle</div>
                     <div class="line">Of some strange nature, letting it there stand</div>
                     <div class="line">Till she had laid it and conjured it down;</div>
                     <div class="line">That were some spite: my invocation</div>
                     <div class="line">Is fair and honest, and in his mistress' name</div>
                     <div class="line">I conjure only but to raise up him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, he hath hid himself among these trees,</div>
                     <div class="line">To be consorted with the humorous night:</div>
                     <div class="line">Blind is his love and best befits the dark.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MERCUTIO</div>
                     <div class="line">If love be blind, love cannot hit the mark.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now will he sit under a medlar tree,</div>
                     <div class="line">And wish his mistress were that kind of fruit</div>
                     <div class="line">As maids call medlars, when they laugh alone.</div>
                     <div class="line">Romeo, that she were, O, that she were</div>
                     <div class="line">An open et caetera, thou a poperin pear!</div>
                     <div class="line">Romeo, good night: I'll to my truckle-bed;</div>
                     <div class="line">This field-bed is too cold for me to sleep:</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, shall we go?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, then; for 'tis in vain</div>
                     <div class="line">To seek him here that means not to be found.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE II.  Capulet's orchard.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ROMEO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">He jests at scars that never felt a wound.</div>
                     <p>JULIET appears above at a window</p>
                     <div class="line">But, soft! what light through yonder window breaks?</div>
                     <div class="line">It is the east, and Juliet is the sun.</div>
                     <div class="line">Arise, fair sun, and kill the envious moon,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who is already sick and pale with grief,</div>
                     <div class="line">That thou her maid art far more fair than she:</div>
                     <div class="line">Be not her maid, since she is envious;</div>
                     <div class="line">Her vestal livery is but sick and green</div>
                     <div class="line">And none but fools do wear it; cast it off.</div>
                     <div class="line">It is my lady, O, it is my love!</div>
                     <div class="line">O, that she knew she were!</div>
                     <div class="line">She speaks yet she says nothing: what of that?</div>
                     <div class="line">Her eye discourses; I will answer it.</div>
                     <div class="line">I am too bold, 'tis not to me she speaks:</div>
                     <div class="line">Two of the fairest stars in all the heaven,</div>
                     <div class="line">Having some business, do entreat her eyes</div>
                     <div class="line">To twinkle in their spheres till they return.</div>
                     <div class="line">What if her eyes were there, they in her head?</div>
                     <div class="line">The brightness of her cheek would shame those stars,</div>
                     <div class="line">As daylight doth a lamp; her eyes in heaven</div>
                     <div class="line">Would through the airy region stream so bright</div>
                     <div class="line">That birds would sing and think it were not night.</div>
                     <div class="line">See, how she leans her cheek upon her hand!</div>
                     <div class="line">O, that I were a glove upon that hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I might touch that cheek!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay me!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">She speaks:</div>
                     <div class="line">O, speak again, bright angel! for thou art</div>
                     <div class="line">As glorious to this night, being o'er my head</div>
                     <div class="line">As is a winged messenger of heaven</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto the white-upturned wondering eyes</div>
                     <div class="line">Of mortals that fall back to gaze on him</div>
                     <div class="line">When he bestrides the lazy-pacing clouds</div>
                     <div class="line">And sails upon the bosom of the air.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">O Romeo, Romeo! wherefore art thou Romeo?</div>
                     <div class="line">Deny thy father and refuse thy name;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or, if thou wilt not, be but sworn my love,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I'll no longer be a Capulet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  Shall I hear more, or shall I speak at this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis but thy name that is my enemy;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art thyself, though not a Montague.</div>
                     <div class="line">What's Montague? it is nor hand, nor foot,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor arm, nor face, nor any other part</div>
                     <div class="line">Belonging to a man. O, be some other name!</div>
                     <div class="line">What's in a name? that which we call a rose</div>
                     <div class="line">By any other name would smell as sweet;</div>
                     <div class="line">So Romeo would, were he not Romeo call'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Retain that dear perfection which he owes</div>
                     <div class="line">Without that title. Romeo, doff thy name,</div>
                     <div class="line">And for that name which is no part of thee</div>
                     <div class="line">Take all myself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">I take thee at thy word:</div>
                     <div class="line">Call me but love, and I'll be new baptized;</div>
                     <div class="line">Henceforth I never will be Romeo.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">What man art thou that thus bescreen'd in night</div>
                     <div class="line">So stumblest on my counsel?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">By a name</div>
                     <div class="line">I know not how to tell thee who I am:</div>
                     <div class="line">My name, dear saint, is hateful to myself,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because it is an enemy to thee;</div>
                     <div class="line">Had I it written, I would tear the word.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">My ears have not yet drunk a hundred words</div>
                     <div class="line">Of that tongue's utterance, yet I know the sound:</div>
                     <div class="line">Art thou not Romeo and a Montague?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Neither, fair saint, if either thee dislike.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">How camest thou hither, tell me, and wherefore?</div>
                     <div class="line">The orchard walls are high and hard to climb,</div>
                     <div class="line">And the place death, considering who thou art,</div>
                     <div class="line">If any of my kinsmen find thee here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">With love's light wings did I o'er-perch these walls;</div>
                     <div class="line">For stony limits cannot hold love out,</div>
                     <div class="line">And what love can do that dares love attempt;</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore thy kinsmen are no let to me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">If they do see thee, they will murder thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Alack, there lies more peril in thine eye</div>
                     <div class="line">Than twenty of their swords: look thou but sweet,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I am proof against their enmity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">I would not for the world they saw thee here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">I have night's cloak to hide me from their sight;</div>
                     <div class="line">And but thou love me, let them find me here:</div>
                     <div class="line">My life were better ended by their hate,</div>
                     <div class="line">Than death prorogued, wanting of thy love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">By whose direction found'st thou out this place?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">By love, who first did prompt me to inquire;</div>
                     <div class="line">He lent me counsel and I lent him eyes.</div>
                     <div class="line">I am no pilot; yet, wert thou as far</div>
                     <div class="line">As that vast shore wash'd with the farthest sea,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would adventure for such merchandise.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou know'st the mask of night is on my face,</div>
                     <div class="line">Else would a maiden blush bepaint my cheek</div>
                     <div class="line">For that which thou hast heard me speak to-night</div>
                     <div class="line">Fain would I dwell on form, fain, fain deny</div>
                     <div class="line">What I have spoke: but farewell compliment!</div>
                     <div class="line">Dost thou love me? I know thou wilt say 'Ay,'</div>
                     <div class="line">And I will take thy word: yet if thou swear'st,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou mayst prove false; at lovers' perjuries</div>
                     <div class="line">Then say, Jove laughs. O gentle Romeo,</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou dost love, pronounce it faithfully:</div>
                     <div class="line">Or if thou think'st I am too quickly won,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll frown and be perverse an say thee nay,</div>
                     <div class="line">So thou wilt woo; but else, not for the world.</div>
                     <div class="line">In truth, fair Montague, I am too fond,</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore thou mayst think my 'havior light:</div>
                     <div class="line">But trust me, gentleman, I'll prove more true</div>
                     <div class="line">Than those that have more cunning to be strange.</div>
                     <div class="line">I should have been more strange, I must confess,</div>
                     <div class="line">But that thou overheard'st, ere I was ware,</div>
                     <div class="line">My true love's passion: therefore pardon me,</div>
                     <div class="line">And not impute this yielding to light love,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which the dark night hath so discovered.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Lady, by yonder blessed moon I swear</div>
                     <div class="line">That tips with silver all these fruit-tree tops--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">O, swear not by the moon, the inconstant moon,</div>
                     <div class="line">That monthly changes in her circled orb,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest that thy love prove likewise variable.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">What shall I swear by?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Do not swear at all;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or, if thou wilt, swear by thy gracious self,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which is the god of my idolatry,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I'll believe thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">If my heart's dear love--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, do not swear: although I joy in thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">I have no joy of this contract to-night:</div>
                     <div class="line">It is too rash, too unadvised, too sudden;</div>
                     <div class="line">Too like the lightning, which doth cease to be</div>
                     <div class="line">Ere one can say 'It lightens.' Sweet, good night!</div>
                     <div class="line">This bud of love, by summer's ripening breath,</div>
                     <div class="line">May prove a beauteous flower when next we meet.</div>
                     <div class="line">Good night, good night! as sweet repose and rest</div>
                     <div class="line">Come to thy heart as that within my breast!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">O, wilt thou leave me so unsatisfied?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">What satisfaction canst thou have to-night?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">The exchange of thy love's faithful vow for mine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">I gave thee mine before thou didst request it:</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet I would it were to give again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Wouldst thou withdraw it? for what purpose, love?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">But to be frank, and give it thee again.</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet I wish but for the thing I have:</div>
                     <div class="line">My bounty is as boundless as the sea,</div>
                     <div class="line">My love as deep; the more I give to thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">The more I have, for both are infinite.</div>
                     <p>Nurse calls within</p>
                     <div class="line">I hear some noise within; dear love, adieu!</div>
                     <div class="line">Anon, good nurse! Sweet Montague, be true.</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay but a little, I will come again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit, above</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">O blessed, blessed night! I am afeard.</div>
                     <div class="line">Being in night, all this is but a dream,</div>
                     <div class="line">Too flattering-sweet to be substantial.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter JULIET, above</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Three words, dear Romeo, and good night indeed.</div>
                     <div class="line">If that thy bent of love be honourable,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy purpose marriage, send me word to-morrow,</div>
                     <div class="line">By one that I'll procure to come to thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where and what time thou wilt perform the rite;</div>
                     <div class="line">And all my fortunes at thy foot I'll lay</div>
                     <div class="line">And follow thee my lord throughout the world.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  Madam!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">I come, anon.--But if thou mean'st not well,</div>
                     <div class="line">I do beseech thee--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  Madam!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">By and by, I come:--</div>
                     <div class="line">To cease thy suit, and leave me to my grief:</div>
                     <div class="line">To-morrow will I send.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">So thrive my soul--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">A thousand times good night!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit, above</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">A thousand times the worse, to want thy light.</div>
                     <div class="line">Love goes toward love, as schoolboys from</div>
                     <div class="line">their books,</div>
                     <div class="line">But love from love, toward school with heavy looks.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Retiring</p>
               <p>Re-enter JULIET, above</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Hist! Romeo, hist! O, for a falconer's voice,</div>
                     <div class="line">To lure this tassel-gentle back again!</div>
                     <div class="line">Bondage is hoarse, and may not speak aloud;</div>
                     <div class="line">Else would I tear the cave where Echo lies,</div>
                     <div class="line">And make her airy tongue more hoarse than mine,</div>
                     <div class="line">With repetition of my Romeo's name.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">It is my soul that calls upon my name:</div>
                     <div class="line">How silver-sweet sound lovers' tongues by night,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like softest music to attending ears!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Romeo!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">My dear?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">At what o'clock to-morrow</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall I send to thee?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">At the hour of nine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not fail: 'tis twenty years till then.</div>
                     <div class="line">I have forgot why I did call thee back.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me stand here till thou remember it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall forget, to have thee still stand there,</div>
                     <div class="line">Remembering how I love thy company.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">And I'll still stay, to have thee still forget,</div>
                     <div class="line">Forgetting any other home but this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis almost morning; I would have thee gone:</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet no further than a wanton's bird;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who lets it hop a little from her hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like a poor prisoner in his twisted gyves,</div>
                     <div class="line">And with a silk thread plucks it back again,</div>
                     <div class="line">So loving-jealous of his liberty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">I would I were thy bird.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet, so would I:</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet I should kill thee with much cherishing.</div>
                     <div class="line">Good night, good night! parting is such</div>
                     <div class="line">sweet sorrow,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I shall say good night till it be morrow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit above</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sleep dwell upon thine eyes, peace in thy breast!</div>
                     <div class="line">Would I were sleep and peace, so sweet to rest!</div>
                     <div class="line">Hence will I to my ghostly father's cell,</div>
                     <div class="line">His help to crave, and my dear hap to tell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE III.  Friar Laurence's cell.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter FRIAR LAURENCE, with a basket</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">The grey-eyed morn smiles on the frowning night,</div>
                     <div class="line">Chequering the eastern clouds with streaks of light,</div>
                     <div class="line">And flecked darkness like a drunkard reels</div>
                     <div class="line">From forth day's path and Titan's fiery wheels:</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, ere the sun advance his burning eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">The day to cheer and night's dank dew to dry,</div>
                     <div class="line">I must up-fill this osier cage of ours</div>
                     <div class="line">With baleful weeds and precious-juiced flowers.</div>
                     <div class="line">The earth that's nature's mother is her tomb;</div>
                     <div class="line">What is her burying grave that is her womb,</div>
                     <div class="line">And from her womb children of divers kind</div>
                     <div class="line">We sucking on her natural bosom find,</div>
                     <div class="line">Many for many virtues excellent,</div>
                     <div class="line">None but for some and yet all different.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, mickle is the powerful grace that lies</div>
                     <div class="line">In herbs, plants, stones, and their true qualities:</div>
                     <div class="line">For nought so vile that on the earth doth live</div>
                     <div class="line">But to the earth some special good doth give,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor aught so good but strain'd from that fair use</div>
                     <div class="line">Revolts from true birth, stumbling on abuse:</div>
                     <div class="line">Virtue itself turns vice, being misapplied;</div>
                     <div class="line">And vice sometimes by action dignified.</div>
                     <div class="line">Within the infant rind of this small flower</div>
                     <div class="line">Poison hath residence and medicine power:</div>
                     <div class="line">For this, being smelt, with that part cheers each part;</div>
                     <div class="line">Being tasted, slays all senses with the heart.</div>
                     <div class="line">Two such opposed kings encamp them still</div>
                     <div class="line">In man as well as herbs, grace and rude will;</div>
                     <div class="line">And where the worser is predominant,</div>
                     <div class="line">Full soon the canker death eats up that plant.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ROMEO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Good morrow, father.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Benedicite!</div>
                     <div class="line">What early tongue so sweet saluteth me?</div>
                     <div class="line">Young son, it argues a distemper'd head</div>
                     <div class="line">So soon to bid good morrow to thy bed:</div>
                     <div class="line">Care keeps his watch in every old man's eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">And where care lodges, sleep will never lie;</div>
                     <div class="line">But where unbruised youth with unstuff'd brain</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth couch his limbs, there golden sleep doth reign:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore thy earliness doth me assure</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art up-roused by some distemperature;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or if not so, then here I hit it right,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our Romeo hath not been in bed to-night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">That last is true; the sweeter rest was mine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">God pardon sin! wast thou with Rosaline?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">With Rosaline, my ghostly father? no;</div>
                     <div class="line">I have forgot that name, and that name's woe.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">That's my good son: but where hast thou been, then?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll tell thee, ere thou ask it me again.</div>
                     <div class="line">I have been feasting with mine enemy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where on a sudden one hath wounded me,</div>
                     <div class="line">That's by me wounded: both our remedies</div>
                     <div class="line">Within thy help and holy physic lies:</div>
                     <div class="line">I bear no hatred, blessed man, for, lo,</div>
                     <div class="line">My intercession likewise steads my foe.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Be plain, good son, and homely in thy drift;</div>
                     <div class="line">Riddling confession finds but riddling shrift.</div>
                  </div>
