                     <div class="line">There lies that Tybalt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">Up, sir, go with me;</div>
                     <div class="line">I charge thee in the princes name, obey.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Prince, attended; MONTAGUE, CAPULET, their
Wives, and others</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Where are the vile beginners of this fray?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">O noble prince, I can discover all</div>
                     <div class="line">The unlucky manage of this fatal brawl:</div>
                     <div class="line">There lies the man, slain by young Romeo,</div>
                     <div class="line">That slew thy kinsman, brave Mercutio.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Tybalt, my cousin! O my brother's child!</div>
                     <div class="line">O prince! O cousin! husband! O, the blood is spilt</div>
                     <div class="line">O my dear kinsman! Prince, as thou art true,</div>
                     <div class="line">For blood of ours, shed blood of Montague.</div>
                     <div class="line">O cousin, cousin!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Benvolio, who began this bloody fray?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Tybalt, here slain, whom Romeo's hand did slay;</div>
                     <div class="line">Romeo that spoke him fair, bade him bethink</div>
                     <div class="line">How nice the quarrel was, and urged withal</div>
                     <div class="line">Your high displeasure: all this uttered</div>
                     <div class="line">With gentle breath, calm look, knees humbly bow'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Could not take truce with the unruly spleen</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Tybalt deaf to peace, but that he tilts</div>
                     <div class="line">With piercing steel at bold Mercutio's breast,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who all as hot, turns deadly point to point,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, with a martial scorn, with one hand beats</div>
                     <div class="line">Cold death aside, and with the other sends</div>
                     <div class="line">It back to Tybalt, whose dexterity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Retorts it: Romeo he cries aloud,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Hold, friends! friends, part!' and, swifter than</div>
                     <div class="line">his tongue,</div>
                     <div class="line">His agile arm beats down their fatal points,</div>
                     <div class="line">And 'twixt them rushes; underneath whose arm</div>
                     <div class="line">An envious thrust from Tybalt hit the life</div>
                     <div class="line">Of stout Mercutio, and then Tybalt fled;</div>
                     <div class="line">But by and by comes back to Romeo,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who had but newly entertain'd revenge,</div>
                     <div class="line">And to 't they go like lightning, for, ere I</div>
                     <div class="line">Could draw to part them, was stout Tybalt slain.</div>
                     <div class="line">And, as he fell, did Romeo turn and fly.</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the truth, or let Benvolio die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">He is a kinsman to the Montague;</div>
                     <div class="line">Affection makes him false; he speaks not true:</div>
                     <div class="line">Some twenty of them fought in this black strife,</div>
                     <div class="line">And all those twenty could but kill one life.</div>
                     <div class="line">I beg for justice, which thou, prince, must give;</div>
                     <div class="line">Romeo slew Tybalt, Romeo must not live.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Romeo slew him, he slew Mercutio;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who now the price of his dear blood doth owe?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                     <div class="line">Not Romeo, prince, he was Mercutio's friend;</div>
                     <div class="line">His fault concludes but what the law should end,</div>
                     <div class="line">The life of Tybalt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">And for that offence</div>
                     <div class="line">Immediately we do exile him hence:</div>
                     <div class="line">I have an interest in your hate's proceeding,</div>
                     <div class="line">My blood for your rude brawls doth lie a-bleeding;</div>
                     <div class="line">But I'll amerce you with so strong a fine</div>
                     <div class="line">That you shall all repent the loss of mine:</div>
                     <div class="line">I will be deaf to pleading and excuses;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor tears nor prayers shall purchase out abuses:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore use none: let Romeo hence in haste,</div>
                     <div class="line">Else, when he's found, that hour is his last.</div>
                     <div class="line">Bear hence this body and attend our will:</div>
                     <div class="line">Mercy but murders, pardoning those that kill.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Capulet's orchard.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter JULIET</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Gallop apace, you fiery-footed steeds,</div>
                     <div class="line">Towards Phoebus' lodging: such a wagoner</div>
                     <div class="line">As Phaethon would whip you to the west,</div>
                     <div class="line">And bring in cloudy night immediately.</div>
                     <div class="line">Spread thy close curtain, love-performing night,</div>
                     <div class="line">That runaway's eyes may wink and Romeo</div>
                     <div class="line">Leap to these arms, untalk'd of and unseen.</div>
                     <div class="line">Lovers can see to do their amorous rites</div>
                     <div class="line">By their own beauties; or, if love be blind,</div>
                     <div class="line">It best agrees with night. Come, civil night,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou sober-suited matron, all in black,</div>
                     <div class="line">And learn me how to lose a winning match,</div>
                     <div class="line">Play'd for a pair of stainless maidenhoods:</div>
                     <div class="line">Hood my unmann'd blood, bating in my cheeks,</div>
                     <div class="line">With thy black mantle; till strange love, grown bold,</div>
                     <div class="line">Think true love acted simple modesty.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, night; come, Romeo; come, thou day in night;</div>
                     <div class="line">For thou wilt lie upon the wings of night</div>
                     <div class="line">Whiter than new snow on a raven's back.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, gentle night, come, loving, black-brow'd night,</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me my Romeo; and, when he shall die,</div>
                     <div class="line">Take him and cut him out in little stars,</div>
                     <div class="line">And he will make the face of heaven so fine</div>
                     <div class="line">That all the world will be in love with night</div>
                     <div class="line">And pay no worship to the garish sun.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, I have bought the mansion of a love,</div>
                     <div class="line">But not possess'd it, and, though I am sold,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not yet enjoy'd: so tedious is this day</div>
                     <div class="line">As is the night before some festival</div>
                     <div class="line">To an impatient child that hath new robes</div>
                     <div class="line">And may not wear them. O, here comes my nurse,</div>
                     <div class="line">And she brings news; and every tongue that speaks</div>
                     <div class="line">But Romeo's name speaks heavenly eloquence.</div>
                     <p>Enter Nurse, with cords</p>
                     <div class="line">Now, nurse, what news? What hast thou there? the cords</div>
                     <div class="line">That Romeo bid thee fetch?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, ay, the cords.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Throws them down</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay me! what news? why dost thou wring thy hands?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, well-a-day! he's dead, he's dead, he's dead!</div>
                     <div class="line">We are undone, lady, we are undone!</div>
                     <div class="line">Alack the day! he's gone, he's kill'd, he's dead!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Can heaven be so envious?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">Romeo can,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though heaven cannot: O Romeo, Romeo!</div>
                     <div class="line">Who ever would have thought it? Romeo!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">What devil art thou, that dost torment me thus?</div>
                     <div class="line">This torture should be roar'd in dismal hell.</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath Romeo slain himself? say thou but 'I,'</div>
                     <div class="line">And that bare vowel 'I' shall poison more</div>
                     <div class="line">Than the death-darting eye of cockatrice:</div>
                     <div class="line">I am not I, if there be such an I;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or those eyes shut, that make thee answer 'I.'</div>
                     <div class="line">If he be slain, say 'I'; or if not, no:</div>
                     <div class="line">Brief sounds determine of my weal or woe.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">I saw the wound, I saw it with mine eyes,--</div>
                     <div class="line">God save the mark!--here on his manly breast:</div>
                     <div class="line">A piteous corse, a bloody piteous corse;</div>
                     <div class="line">Pale, pale as ashes, all bedaub'd in blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">All in gore-blood; I swounded at the sight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">O, break, my heart! poor bankrupt, break at once!</div>
                     <div class="line">To prison, eyes, ne'er look on liberty!</div>
                     <div class="line">Vile earth, to earth resign; end motion here;</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou and Romeo press one heavy bier!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">O Tybalt, Tybalt, the best friend I had!</div>
                     <div class="line">O courteous Tybalt! honest gentleman!</div>
                     <div class="line">That ever I should live to see thee dead!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">What storm is this that blows so contrary?</div>
                     <div class="line">Is Romeo slaughter'd, and is Tybalt dead?</div>
                     <div class="line">My dear-loved cousin, and my dearer lord?</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, dreadful trumpet, sound the general doom!</div>
                     <div class="line">For who is living, if those two are gone?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">Tybalt is gone, and Romeo banished;</div>
                     <div class="line">Romeo that kill'd him, he is banished.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">O God! did Romeo's hand shed Tybalt's blood?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">It did, it did; alas the day, it did!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">O serpent heart, hid with a flowering face!</div>
                     <div class="line">Did ever dragon keep so fair a cave?</div>
                     <div class="line">Beautiful tyrant! fiend angelical!</div>
                     <div class="line">Dove-feather'd raven! wolvish-ravening lamb!</div>
                     <div class="line">Despised substance of divinest show!</div>
                     <div class="line">Just opposite to what thou justly seem'st,</div>
                     <div class="line">A damned saint, an honourable villain!</div>
                     <div class="line">O nature, what hadst thou to do in hell,</div>
                     <div class="line">When thou didst bower the spirit of a fiend</div>
                     <div class="line">In moral paradise of such sweet flesh?</div>
                     <div class="line">Was ever book containing such vile matter</div>
                     <div class="line">So fairly bound? O that deceit should dwell</div>
                     <div class="line">In such a gorgeous palace!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">There's no trust,</div>
                     <div class="line">No faith, no honesty in men; all perjured,</div>
                     <div class="line">All forsworn, all naught, all dissemblers.</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, where's my man? give me some aqua vitae:</div>
                     <div class="line">These griefs, these woes, these sorrows make me old.</div>
                     <div class="line">Shame come to Romeo!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Blister'd be thy tongue</div>
                     <div class="line">For such a wish! he was not born to shame:</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon his brow shame is ashamed to sit;</div>
                     <div class="line">For 'tis a throne where honour may be crown'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Sole monarch of the universal earth.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, what a beast was I to chide at him!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you speak well of him that kill'd your cousin?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall I speak ill of him that is my husband?</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, poor my lord, what tongue shall smooth thy name,</div>
                     <div class="line">When I, thy three-hours wife, have mangled it?</div>
                     <div class="line">But, wherefore, villain, didst thou kill my cousin?</div>
                     <div class="line">That villain cousin would have kill'd my husband:</div>
                     <div class="line">Back, foolish tears, back to your native spring;</div>
                     <div class="line">Your tributary drops belong to woe,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which you, mistaking, offer up to joy.</div>
                     <div class="line">My husband lives, that Tybalt would have slain;</div>
                     <div class="line">And Tybalt's dead, that would have slain my husband:</div>
                     <div class="line">All this is comfort; wherefore weep I then?</div>
                     <div class="line">Some word there was, worser than Tybalt's death,</div>
                     <div class="line">That murder'd me: I would forget it fain;</div>
                     <div class="line">But, O, it presses to my memory,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like damned guilty deeds to sinners' minds:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tybalt is dead, and Romeo--banished;'</div>
                     <div class="line">That 'banished,' that one word 'banished,'</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath slain ten thousand Tybalts. Tybalt's death</div>
                     <div class="line">Was woe enough, if it had ended there:</div>
                     <div class="line">Or, if sour woe delights in fellowship</div>
                     <div class="line">And needly will be rank'd with other griefs,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why follow'd not, when she said 'Tybalt's dead,'</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy father, or thy mother, nay, or both,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which modern lamentations might have moved?</div>
                     <div class="line">But with a rear-ward following Tybalt's death,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Romeo is banished,' to speak that word,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is father, mother, Tybalt, Romeo, Juliet,</div>
                     <div class="line">All slain, all dead. 'Romeo is banished!'</div>
                     <div class="line">There is no end, no limit, measure, bound,</div>
                     <div class="line">In that word's death; no words can that woe sound.</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is my father, and my mother, nurse?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">Weeping and wailing over Tybalt's corse:</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you go to them? I will bring you thither.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Wash they his wounds with tears: mine shall be spent,</div>
                     <div class="line">When theirs are dry, for Romeo's banishment.</div>
                     <div class="line">Take up those cords: poor ropes, you are beguiled,</div>
                     <div class="line">Both you and I; for Romeo is exiled:</div>
                     <div class="line">He made you for a highway to my bed;</div>
                     <div class="line">But I, a maid, die maiden-widowed.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, cords, come, nurse; I'll to my wedding-bed;</div>
                     <div class="line">And death, not Romeo, take my maidenhead!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">Hie to your chamber: I'll find Romeo</div>
                     <div class="line">To comfort you: I wot well where he is.</div>
                     <div class="line">Hark ye, your Romeo will be here at night:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll to him; he is hid at Laurence' cell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">O, find him! give this ring to my true knight,</div>
                     <div class="line">And bid him come to take his last farewell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  Friar Laurence's cell.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter FRIAR LAURENCE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Romeo, come forth; come forth, thou fearful man:</div>
                     <div class="line">Affliction is enamour'd of thy parts,</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou art wedded to calamity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ROMEO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Father, what news? what is the prince's doom?</div>
                     <div class="line">What sorrow craves acquaintance at my hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I yet know not?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Too familiar</div>
                     <div class="line">Is my dear son with such sour company:</div>
                     <div class="line">I bring thee tidings of the prince's doom.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">What less than dooms-day is the prince's doom?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">A gentler judgment vanish'd from his lips,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not body's death, but body's banishment.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha, banishment! be merciful, say 'death;'</div>
                     <div class="line">For exile hath more terror in his look,</div>
                     <div class="line">Much more than death: do not say 'banishment.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Hence from Verona art thou banished:</div>
                     <div class="line">Be patient, for the world is broad and wide.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">There is no world without Verona walls,</div>
                     <div class="line">But purgatory, torture, hell itself.</div>
                     <div class="line">Hence-banished is banish'd from the world,</div>
                     <div class="line">And world's exile is death: then banished,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is death mis-term'd: calling death banishment,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou cutt'st my head off with a golden axe,</div>
                     <div class="line">And smilest upon the stroke that murders me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">O deadly sin! O rude unthankfulness!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy fault our law calls death; but the kind prince,</div>
                     <div class="line">Taking thy part, hath rush'd aside the law,</div>
                     <div class="line">And turn'd that black word death to banishment:</div>
                     <div class="line">This is dear mercy, and thou seest it not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis torture, and not mercy: heaven is here,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where Juliet lives; and every cat and dog</div>
                     <div class="line">And little mouse, every unworthy thing,</div>
                     <div class="line">Live here in heaven and may look on her;</div>
                     <div class="line">But Romeo may not: more validity,</div>
                     <div class="line">More honourable state, more courtship lives</div>
                     <div class="line">In carrion-flies than Romeo: they my seize</div>
                     <div class="line">On the white wonder of dear Juliet's hand</div>
                     <div class="line">And steal immortal blessing from her lips,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who even in pure and vestal modesty,</div>
                     <div class="line">Still blush, as thinking their own kisses sin;</div>
                     <div class="line">But Romeo may not; he is banished:</div>
                     <div class="line">Flies may do this, but I from this must fly:</div>
                     <div class="line">They are free men, but I am banished.</div>
                     <div class="line">And say'st thou yet that exile is not death?</div>
                     <div class="line">Hadst thou no poison mix'd, no sharp-ground knife,</div>
                     <div class="line">No sudden mean of death, though ne'er so mean,</div>
                     <div class="line">But 'banished' to kill me?--'banished'?</div>
                     <div class="line">O friar, the damned use that word in hell;</div>
                     <div class="line">Howlings attend it: how hast thou the heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being a divine, a ghostly confessor,</div>
                     <div class="line">A sin-absolver, and my friend profess'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">To mangle me with that word 'banished'?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou fond mad man, hear me but speak a word.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">O, thou wilt speak again of banishment.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll give thee armour to keep off that word:</div>
                     <div class="line">Adversity's sweet milk, philosophy,</div>
                     <div class="line">To comfort thee, though thou art banished.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet 'banished'? Hang up philosophy!</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless philosophy can make a Juliet,</div>
                     <div class="line">Displant a town, reverse a prince's doom,</div>
                     <div class="line">It helps not, it prevails not: talk no more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">O, then I see that madmen have no ears.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">How should they, when that wise men have no eyes?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me dispute with thee of thy estate.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou canst not speak of that thou dost not feel:</div>
                     <div class="line">Wert thou as young as I, Juliet thy love,</div>
                     <div class="line">An hour but married, Tybalt murdered,</div>
                     <div class="line">Doting like me and like me banished,</div>
                     <div class="line">Then mightst thou speak, then mightst thou tear thy hair,</div>
                     <div class="line">And fall upon the ground, as I do now,</div>
                     <div class="line">Taking the measure of an unmade grave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Knocking within</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Arise; one knocks; good Romeo, hide thyself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Not I; unless the breath of heartsick groans,</div>
                     <div class="line">Mist-like, infold me from the search of eyes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Knocking</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Hark, how they knock! Who's there? Romeo, arise;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou wilt be taken. Stay awhile! Stand up;</div>
                     <p>Knocking</p>
                     <div class="line">Run to my study. By and by! God's will,</div>
                     <div class="line">What simpleness is this! I come, I come!</div>
                     <p>Knocking</p>
                     <div class="line">Who knocks so hard? whence come you? what's your will?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  Let me come in, and you shall know</div>
                     <div class="line">my errand;</div>
                     <div class="line">I come from Lady Juliet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Welcome, then.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Nurse</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">O holy friar, O, tell me, holy friar,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is my lady's lord, where's Romeo?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">There on the ground, with his own tears made drunk.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">O, he is even in my mistress' case,</div>
                     <div class="line">Just in her case! O woful sympathy!</div>
                     <div class="line">Piteous predicament! Even so lies she,</div>
                     <div class="line">Blubbering and weeping, weeping and blubbering.</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand up, stand up; stand, and you be a man:</div>
                     <div class="line">For Juliet's sake, for her sake, rise and stand;</div>
                     <div class="line">Why should you fall into so deep an O?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Nurse!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah sir! ah sir! Well, death's the end of all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Spakest thou of Juliet? how is it with her?</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth she not think me an old murderer,</div>
                     <div class="line">Now I have stain'd the childhood of our joy</div>
                     <div class="line">With blood removed but little from her own?</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is she? and how doth she? and what says</div>
                     <div class="line">My conceal'd lady to our cancell'd love?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">O, she says nothing, sir, but weeps and weeps;</div>
                     <div class="line">And now falls on her bed; and then starts up,</div>
                     <div class="line">And Tybalt calls; and then on Romeo cries,</div>
                     <div class="line">And then down falls again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">As if that name,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shot from the deadly level of a gun,</div>
                     <div class="line">Did murder her; as that name's cursed hand</div>
                     <div class="line">Murder'd her kinsman. O, tell me, friar, tell me,</div>
                     <div class="line">In what vile part of this anatomy</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth my name lodge? tell me, that I may sack</div>
                     <div class="line">The hateful mansion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Drawing his sword</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold thy desperate hand:</div>
                     <div class="line">Art thou a man? thy form cries out thou art:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy tears are womanish; thy wild acts denote</div>
                     <div class="line">The unreasonable fury of a beast:</div>
                     <div class="line">Unseemly woman in a seeming man!</div>
                     <div class="line">Or ill-beseeming beast in seeming both!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast amazed me: by my holy order,</div>
                     <div class="line">I thought thy disposition better temper'd.</div>
                     <div class="line">Hast thou slain Tybalt? wilt thou slay thyself?</div>
                     <div class="line">And stay thy lady too that lives in thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">By doing damned hate upon thyself?</div>
                     <div class="line">Why rail'st thou on thy birth, the heaven, and earth?</div>
                     <div class="line">Since birth, and heaven, and earth, all three do meet</div>
                     <div class="line">In thee at once; which thou at once wouldst lose.</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie, fie, thou shamest thy shape, thy love, thy wit;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, like a usurer, abound'st in all,</div>
                     <div class="line">And usest none in that true use indeed</div>
                     <div class="line">Which should bedeck thy shape, thy love, thy wit:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy noble shape is but a form of wax,</div>
                     <div class="line">Digressing from the valour of a man;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy dear love sworn but hollow perjury,</div>
                     <div class="line">Killing that love which thou hast vow'd to cherish;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy wit, that ornament to shape and love,</div>
                     <div class="line">Misshapen in the conduct of them both,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like powder in a skitless soldier's flask,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is set afire by thine own ignorance,</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou dismember'd with thine own defence.</div>
                     <div class="line">What, rouse thee, man! thy Juliet is alive,</div>
                     <div class="line">For whose dear sake thou wast but lately dead;</div>
                     <div class="line">There art thou happy: Tybalt would kill thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">But thou slew'st Tybalt; there are thou happy too:</div>
                     <div class="line">The law that threaten'd death becomes thy friend</div>
                     <div class="line">And turns it to exile; there art thou happy:</div>
                     <div class="line">A pack of blessings lights up upon thy back;</div>
                     <div class="line">Happiness courts thee in her best array;</div>
                     <div class="line">But, like a misbehaved and sullen wench,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou pout'st upon thy fortune and thy love:</div>
                     <div class="line">Take heed, take heed, for such die miserable.</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, get thee to thy love, as was decreed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ascend her chamber, hence and comfort her:</div>
                     <div class="line">But look thou stay not till the watch be set,</div>
                     <div class="line">For then thou canst not pass to Mantua;</div>
                     <div class="line">Where thou shalt live, till we can find a time</div>
                     <div class="line">To blaze your marriage, reconcile your friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">Beg pardon of the prince, and call thee back</div>
                     <div class="line">With twenty hundred thousand times more joy</div>
                     <div class="line">Than thou went'st forth in lamentation.</div>
                     <div class="line">Go before, nurse: commend me to thy lady;</div>
                     <div class="line">And bid her hasten all the house to bed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which heavy sorrow makes them apt unto:</div>
                     <div class="line">Romeo is coming.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">O Lord, I could have stay'd here all the night</div>
                     <div class="line">To hear good counsel: O, what learning is!</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I'll tell my lady you will come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Do so, and bid my sweet prepare to chide.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, sir, a ring she bid me give you, sir:</div>
                     <div class="line">Hie you, make haste, for it grows very late.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">How well my comfort is revived by this!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Go hence; good night; and here stands all your state:</div>
                     <div class="line">Either be gone before the watch be set,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or by the break of day disguised from hence:</div>
                     <div class="line">Sojourn in Mantua; I'll find out your man,</div>
                     <div class="line">And he shall signify from time to time</div>
                     <div class="line">Every good hap to you that chances here:</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me thy hand; 'tis late: farewell; good night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">But that a joy past joy calls out on me,</div>
                     <div class="line">It were a grief, so brief to part with thee: Farewell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CAPULET, LADY CAPULET, and PARIS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Things have fall'n out, sir, so unluckily,</div>
                     <div class="line">That we have had no time to move our daughter:</div>
                     <div class="line">Look you, she loved her kinsman Tybalt dearly,</div>
                     <div class="line">And so did I:--Well, we were born to die.</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis very late, she'll not come down to-night:</div>
                     <div class="line">I promise you, but for your company,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would have been a-bed an hour ago.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">These times of woe afford no time to woo.</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, good night: commend me to your daughter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">I will, and know her mind early to-morrow;</div>
                     <div class="line">To-night she is mew'd up to her heaviness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Paris, I will make a desperate tender</div>
                     <div class="line">Of my child's love: I think she will be ruled</div>
                     <div class="line">In all respects by me; nay, more, I doubt it not.</div>
                     <div class="line">Wife, go you to her ere you go to bed;</div>
                     <div class="line">Acquaint her here of my son Paris' love;</div>
                     <div class="line">And bid her, mark you me, on Wednesday next--</div>
                     <div class="line">But, soft! what day is this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Monday, my lord,</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Monday! ha, ha! Well, Wednesday is too soon,</div>
                     <div class="line">O' Thursday let it be: o' Thursday, tell her,</div>
                     <div class="line">She shall be married to this noble earl.</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you be ready? do you like this haste?</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll keep no great ado,--a friend or two;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, hark you, Tybalt being slain so late,</div>
                     <div class="line">It may be thought we held him carelessly,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being our kinsman, if we revel much:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore we'll have some half a dozen friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">And there an end. But what say you to Thursday?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I would that Thursday were to-morrow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Well get you gone: o' Thursday be it, then.</div>
                     <div class="line">Go you to Juliet ere you go to bed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Prepare her, wife, against this wedding-day.</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, my lord. Light to my chamber, ho!</div>
                     <div class="line">Afore me! it is so very very late,</div>
                     <div class="line">That we may call it early by and by.</div>
                     <div class="line">Good night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.6">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>5. SCENE V.  Capulet's orchard.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ROMEO and JULIET above, at the window</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Wilt thou be gone? it is not yet near day:</div>
                     <div class="line">It was the nightingale, and not the lark,</div>
                     <div class="line">That pierced the fearful hollow of thine ear;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nightly she sings on yon pomegranate-tree:</div>
                     <div class="line">Believe me, love, it was the nightingale.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">It was the lark, the herald of the morn,</div>
                     <div class="line">No nightingale: look, love, what envious streaks</div>
                     <div class="line">Do lace the severing clouds in yonder east:</div>
                     <div class="line">Night's candles are burnt out, and jocund day</div>
                     <div class="line">Stands tiptoe on the misty mountain tops.</div>
                     <div class="line">I must be gone and live, or stay and die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Yon light is not day-light, I know it, I:</div>
                     <div class="line">It is some meteor that the sun exhales,</div>
                     <div class="line">To be to thee this night a torch-bearer,</div>
                     <div class="line">And light thee on thy way to Mantua:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore stay yet; thou need'st not to be gone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me be ta'en, let me be put to death;</div>
                     <div class="line">I am content, so thou wilt have it so.</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll say yon grey is not the morning's eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis but the pale reflex of Cynthia's brow;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor that is not the lark, whose notes do beat</div>
                     <div class="line">The vaulty heaven so high above our heads:</div>
                     <div class="line">I have more care to stay than will to go:</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, death, and welcome! Juliet wills it so.</div>
                     <div class="line">How is't, my soul? let's talk; it is not day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">It is, it is: hie hence, be gone, away!</div>
                     <div class="line">It is the lark that sings so out of tune,</div>
                     <div class="line">Straining harsh discords and unpleasing sharps.</div>
                     <div class="line">Some say the lark makes sweet division;</div>
                     <div class="line">This doth not so, for she divideth us:</div>
                     <div class="line">Some say the lark and loathed toad change eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">O, now I would they had changed voices too!</div>
                     <div class="line">Since arm from arm that voice doth us affray,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hunting thee hence with hunt's-up to the day,</div>
                     <div class="line">O, now be gone; more light and light it grows.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">More light and light; more dark and dark our woes!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Nurse, to the chamber</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Nurse?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">Your lady mother is coming to your chamber:</div>
                     <div class="line">The day is broke; be wary, look about.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, window, let day in, and let life out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, farewell! one kiss, and I'll descend.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>He goeth down</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Art thou gone so? love, lord, ay, husband, friend!</div>
                     <div class="line">I must hear from thee every day in the hour,</div>
                     <div class="line">For in a minute there are many days:</div>
                     <div class="line">O, by this count I shall be much in years</div>
                     <div class="line">Ere I again behold my Romeo!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell!</div>
                     <div class="line">I will omit no opportunity</div>
                     <div class="line">That may convey my greetings, love, to thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">O think'st thou we shall ever meet again?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">I doubt it not; and all these woes shall serve</div>
                     <div class="line">For sweet discourses in our time to come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">O God, I have an ill-divining soul!</div>
                     <div class="line">Methinks I see thee, now thou art below,</div>
                     <div class="line">As one dead in the bottom of a tomb:</div>
                     <div class="line">Either my eyesight fails, or thou look'st pale.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">And trust me, love, in my eye so do you:</div>
                     <div class="line">Dry sorrow drinks our blood. Adieu, adieu!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">O fortune, fortune! all men call thee fickle:</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou art fickle, what dost thou with him.</div>
                     <div class="line">That is renown'd for faith? Be fickle, fortune;</div>
                     <div class="line">For then, I hope, thou wilt not keep him long,</div>
                     <div class="line">But send him back.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>         Ho, daughter! are you up?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Who is't that calls? is it my lady mother?</div>
                     <div class="line">Is she not down so late, or up so early?</div>
                     <div class="line">What unaccustom'd cause procures her hither?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter LADY CAPULET</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, how now, Juliet!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, I am not well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Evermore weeping for your cousin's death?</div>
                     <div class="line">What, wilt thou wash him from his grave with tears?</div>
                     <div class="line">An if thou couldst, thou couldst not make him live;</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, have done: some grief shows much of love;</div>
                     <div class="line">But much of grief shows still some want of wit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet let me weep for such a feeling loss.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">So shall you feel the loss, but not the friend</div>
                     <div class="line">Which you weep for.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Feeling so the loss,</div>
                     <div class="line">Cannot choose but ever weep the friend.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, girl, thou weep'st not so much for his death,</div>
                     <div class="line">As that the villain lives which slaughter'd him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">What villain madam?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">That same villain, Romeo.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  Villain and he be many miles asunder.--</div>
                     <div class="line">God Pardon him! I do, with all my heart;</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet no man like he doth grieve my heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">That is, because the traitor murderer lives.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, madam, from the reach of these my hands:</div>
                     <div class="line">Would none but I might venge my cousin's death!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">We will have vengeance for it, fear thou not:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then weep no more. I'll send to one in Mantua,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where that same banish'd runagate doth live,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall give him such an unaccustom'd dram,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he shall soon keep Tybalt company:</div>
                     <div class="line">And then, I hope, thou wilt be satisfied.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, I never shall be satisfied</div>
                     <div class="line">With Romeo, till I behold him--dead--</div>
                     <div class="line">Is my poor heart for a kinsman vex'd.</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, if you could find out but a man</div>
                     <div class="line">To bear a poison, I would temper it;</div>
                     <div class="line">That Romeo should, upon receipt thereof,</div>
                     <div class="line">Soon sleep in quiet. O, how my heart abhors</div>
                     <div class="line">To hear him named, and cannot come to him.</div>
                     <div class="line">To wreak the love I bore my cousin</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon his body that slaughter'd him!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Find thou the means, and I'll find such a man.</div>
                     <div class="line">But now I'll tell thee joyful tidings, girl.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">And joy comes well in such a needy time:</div>
                     <div class="line">What are they, I beseech your ladyship?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, well, thou hast a careful father, child;</div>
                     <div class="line">One who, to put thee from thy heaviness,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath sorted out a sudden day of joy,</div>
                     <div class="line">That thou expect'st not nor I look'd not for.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, in happy time, what day is that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, my child, early next Thursday morn,</div>
                     <div class="line">The gallant, young and noble gentleman,</div>
                     <div class="line">The County Paris, at Saint Peter's Church,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall happily make thee there a joyful bride.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, by Saint Peter's Church and Peter too,</div>
                     <div class="line">He shall not make me there a joyful bride.</div>
                     <div class="line">I wonder at this haste; that I must wed</div>
                     <div class="line">Ere he, that should be husband, comes to woo.</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, tell my lord and father, madam,</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not marry yet; and, when I do, I swear,</div>
                     <div class="line">It shall be Romeo, whom you know I hate,</div>
                     <div class="line">Rather than Paris. These are news indeed!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Here comes your father; tell him so yourself,</div>
                     <div class="line">And see how he will take it at your hands.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CAPULET and Nurse</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">When the sun sets, the air doth drizzle dew;</div>
                     <div class="line">But for the sunset of my brother's son</div>
                     <div class="line">It rains downright.</div>
                     <div class="line">How now! a conduit, girl? what, still in tears?</div>
                     <div class="line">Evermore showering? In one little body</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou counterfeit'st a bark, a sea, a wind;</div>
                     <div class="line">For still thy eyes, which I may call the sea,</div>
                     <div class="line">Do ebb and flow with tears; the bark thy body is,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sailing in this salt flood; the winds, thy sighs;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, raging with thy tears, and they with them,</div>
                     <div class="line">Without a sudden calm, will overset</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy tempest-tossed body. How now, wife!</div>
                     <div class="line">Have you deliver'd to her our decree?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, sir; but she will none, she gives you thanks.</div>
                     <div class="line">I would the fool were married to her grave!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Soft! take me with you, take me with you, wife.</div>
                     <div class="line">How! will she none? doth she not give us thanks?</div>
                     <div class="line">Is she not proud? doth she not count her blest,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unworthy as she is, that we have wrought</div>
                     <div class="line">So worthy a gentleman to be her bridegroom?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Not proud, you have; but thankful, that you have:</div>
                     <div class="line">Proud can I never be of what I hate;</div>
                     <div class="line">But thankful even for hate, that is meant love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, how now, chop-logic! What is this?</div>
                     <div class="line">'Proud,' and 'I thank you,' and 'I thank you not;'</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet 'not proud,' mistress minion, you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thank me no thankings, nor, proud me no prouds,</div>
                     <div class="line">But fettle your fine joints 'gainst Thursday next,</div>
                     <div class="line">To go with Paris to Saint Peter's Church,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or I will drag thee on a hurdle thither.</div>
                     <div class="line">Out, you green-sickness carrion! out, you baggage!</div>
                     <div class="line">You tallow-face!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie, fie! what, are you mad?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Good father, I beseech you on my knees,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hear me with patience but to speak a word.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Hang thee, young baggage! disobedient wretch!</div>
                     <div class="line">I tell thee what: get thee to church o' Thursday,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or never after look me in the face:</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak not, reply not, do not answer me;</div>
                     <div class="line">My fingers itch. Wife, we scarce thought us blest</div>
                     <div class="line">That God had lent us but this only child;</div>
                     <div class="line">But now I see this one is one too much,</div>
                     <div class="line">And that we have a curse in having her:</div>
                     <div class="line">Out on her, hilding!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">God in heaven bless her!</div>
                     <div class="line">You are to blame, my lord, to rate her so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">And why, my lady wisdom? hold your tongue,</div>
                     <div class="line">Good prudence; smatter with your gossips, go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">I speak no treason.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">O, God ye god-den.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">May not one speak?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, you mumbling fool!</div>
                     <div class="line">Utter your gravity o'er a gossip's bowl;</div>
                     <div class="line">For here we need it not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">You are too hot.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">God's bread! it makes me mad:</div>
                     <div class="line">Day, night, hour, tide, time, work, play,</div>
                     <div class="line">Alone, in company, still my care hath been</div>
                     <div class="line">To have her match'd: and having now provided</div>
                     <div class="line">A gentleman of noble parentage,</div>
