                     <div class="line">Of fair demesnes, youthful, and nobly train'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Stuff'd, as they say, with honourable parts,</div>
                     <div class="line">Proportion'd as one's thought would wish a man;</div>
                     <div class="line">And then to have a wretched puling fool,</div>
                     <div class="line">A whining mammet, in her fortune's tender,</div>
                     <div class="line">To answer 'I'll not wed; I cannot love,</div>
                     <div class="line">I am too young; I pray you, pardon me.'</div>
                     <div class="line">But, as you will not wed, I'll pardon you:</div>
                     <div class="line">Graze where you will you shall not house with me:</div>
                     <div class="line">Look to't, think on't, I do not use to jest.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thursday is near; lay hand on heart, advise:</div>
                     <div class="line">An you be mine, I'll give you to my friend;</div>
                     <div class="line">And you be not, hang, beg, starve, die in</div>
                     <div class="line">the streets,</div>
                     <div class="line">For, by my soul, I'll ne'er acknowledge thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor what is mine shall never do thee good:</div>
                     <div class="line">Trust to't, bethink you; I'll not be forsworn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Is there no pity sitting in the clouds,</div>
                     <div class="line">That sees into the bottom of my grief?</div>
                     <div class="line">O, sweet my mother, cast me not away!</div>
                     <div class="line">Delay this marriage for a month, a week;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or, if you do not, make the bridal bed</div>
                     <div class="line">In that dim monument where Tybalt lies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Talk not to me, for I'll not speak a word:</div>
                     <div class="line">Do as thou wilt, for I have done with thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">O God!--O nurse, how shall this be prevented?</div>
                     <div class="line">My husband is on earth, my faith in heaven;</div>
                     <div class="line">How shall that faith return again to earth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless that husband send it me from heaven</div>
                     <div class="line">By leaving earth? comfort me, counsel me.</div>
                     <div class="line">Alack, alack, that heaven should practise stratagems</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon so soft a subject as myself!</div>
                     <div class="line">What say'st thou? hast thou not a word of joy?</div>
                     <div class="line">Some comfort, nurse.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, here it is.</div>
                     <div class="line">Romeo is banish'd; and all the world to nothing,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he dares ne'er come back to challenge you;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or, if he do, it needs must be by stealth.</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, since the case so stands as now it doth,</div>
                     <div class="line">I think it best you married with the county.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, he's a lovely gentleman!</div>
                     <div class="line">Romeo's a dishclout to him: an eagle, madam,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath not so green, so quick, so fair an eye</div>
                     <div class="line">As Paris hath. Beshrew my very heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">I think you are happy in this second match,</div>
                     <div class="line">For it excels your first: or if it did not,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your first is dead; or 'twere as good he were,</div>
                     <div class="line">As living here and you no use of him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Speakest thou from thy heart?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">And from my soul too;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or else beshrew them both.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Amen!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">What?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, thou hast comforted me marvellous much.</div>
                     <div class="line">Go in: and tell my lady I am gone,</div>
                     <div class="line">Having displeased my father, to Laurence' cell,</div>
                     <div class="line">To make confession and to be absolved.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, I will; and this is wisely done.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ancient damnation! O most wicked fiend!</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it more sin to wish me thus forsworn,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or to dispraise my lord with that same tongue</div>
                     <div class="line">Which she hath praised him with above compare</div>
                     <div class="line">So many thousand times? Go, counsellor;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou and my bosom henceforth shall be twain.</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll to the friar, to know his remedy:</div>
                     <div class="line">If all else fail, myself have power to die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.6">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 4. ACT IV</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.2">1. SCENE I.  Friar Laurence's cell.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.3">2. SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.4">3. SCENE III.  Juliet's chamber.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.5">4. SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.6">5. SCENE V.  Juliet's chamber.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Friar Laurence's cell.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter FRIAR LAURENCE and PARIS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">On Thursday, sir? the time is very short.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">My father Capulet will have it so;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I am nothing slow to slack his haste.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">You say you do not know the lady's mind:</div>
                     <div class="line">Uneven is the course, I like it not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Immoderately she weeps for Tybalt's death,</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore have I little talk'd of love;</div>
                     <div class="line">For Venus smiles not in a house of tears.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, sir, her father counts it dangerous</div>
                     <div class="line">That she doth give her sorrow so much sway,</div>
                     <div class="line">And in his wisdom hastes our marriage,</div>
                     <div class="line">To stop the inundation of her tears;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, too much minded by herself alone,</div>
                     <div class="line">May be put from her by society:</div>
                     <div class="line">Now do you know the reason of this haste.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  I would I knew not why it should be slow'd.</div>
                     <div class="line">Look, sir, here comes the lady towards my cell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter JULIET</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Happily met, my lady and my wife!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">That may be, sir, when I may be a wife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">That may be must be, love, on Thursday next.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">What must be shall be.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">That's a certain text.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Come you to make confession to this father?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">To answer that, I should confess to you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Do not deny to him that you love me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">I will confess to you that I love him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">So will ye, I am sure, that you love me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">If I do so, it will be of more price,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being spoke behind your back, than to your face.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Poor soul, thy face is much abused with tears.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">The tears have got small victory by that;</div>
                     <div class="line">For it was bad enough before their spite.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou wrong'st it, more than tears, with that report.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">That is no slander, sir, which is a truth;</div>
                     <div class="line">And what I spake, I spake it to my face.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy face is mine, and thou hast slander'd it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">It may be so, for it is not mine own.</div>
                     <div class="line">Are you at leisure, holy father, now;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or shall I come to you at evening mass?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">My leisure serves me, pensive daughter, now.</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, we must entreat the time alone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">God shield I should disturb devotion!</div>
                     <div class="line">Juliet, on Thursday early will I rouse ye:</div>
                     <div class="line">Till then, adieu; and keep this holy kiss.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">O shut the door! and when thou hast done so,</div>
                     <div class="line">Come weep with me; past hope, past cure, past help!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, Juliet, I already know thy grief;</div>
                     <div class="line">It strains me past the compass of my wits:</div>
                     <div class="line">I hear thou must, and nothing may prorogue it,</div>
                     <div class="line">On Thursday next be married to this county.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell me not, friar, that thou hear'st of this,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless thou tell me how I may prevent it:</div>
                     <div class="line">If, in thy wisdom, thou canst give no help,</div>
                     <div class="line">Do thou but call my resolution wise,</div>
                     <div class="line">And with this knife I'll help it presently.</div>
                     <div class="line">God join'd my heart and Romeo's, thou our hands;</div>
                     <div class="line">And ere this hand, by thee to Romeo seal'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall be the label to another deed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or my true heart with treacherous revolt</div>
                     <div class="line">Turn to another, this shall slay them both:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, out of thy long-experienced time,</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me some present counsel, or, behold,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twixt my extremes and me this bloody knife</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall play the umpire, arbitrating that</div>
                     <div class="line">Which the commission of thy years and art</div>
                     <div class="line">Could to no issue of true honour bring.</div>
                     <div class="line">Be not so long to speak; I long to die,</div>
                     <div class="line">If what thou speak'st speak not of remedy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold, daughter: I do spy a kind of hope,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which craves as desperate an execution.</div>
                     <div class="line">As that is desperate which we would prevent.</div>
                     <div class="line">If, rather than to marry County Paris,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast the strength of will to slay thyself,</div>
                     <div class="line">Then is it likely thou wilt undertake</div>
                     <div class="line">A thing like death to chide away this shame,</div>
                     <div class="line">That copest with death himself to scape from it:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, if thou darest, I'll give thee remedy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">O, bid me leap, rather than marry Paris,</div>
                     <div class="line">From off the battlements of yonder tower;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or walk in thievish ways; or bid me lurk</div>
                     <div class="line">Where serpents are; chain me with roaring bears;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or shut me nightly in a charnel-house,</div>
                     <div class="line">O'er-cover'd quite with dead men's rattling bones,</div>
                     <div class="line">With reeky shanks and yellow chapless skulls;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or bid me go into a new-made grave</div>
                     <div class="line">And hide me with a dead man in his shroud;</div>
                     <div class="line">Things that, to hear them told, have made me tremble;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I will do it without fear or doubt,</div>
                     <div class="line">To live an unstain'd wife to my sweet love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold, then; go home, be merry, give consent</div>
                     <div class="line">To marry Paris: Wednesday is to-morrow:</div>
                     <div class="line">To-morrow night look that thou lie alone;</div>
                     <div class="line">Let not thy nurse lie with thee in thy chamber:</div>
                     <div class="line">Take thou this vial, being then in bed,</div>
                     <div class="line">And this distilled liquor drink thou off;</div>
                     <div class="line">When presently through all thy veins shall run</div>
                     <div class="line">A cold and drowsy humour, for no pulse</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall keep his native progress, but surcease:</div>
                     <div class="line">No warmth, no breath, shall testify thou livest;</div>
                     <div class="line">The roses in thy lips and cheeks shall fade</div>
                     <div class="line">To paly ashes, thy eyes' windows fall,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like death, when he shuts up the day of life;</div>
                     <div class="line">Each part, deprived of supple government,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall, stiff and stark and cold, appear like death:</div>
                     <div class="line">And in this borrow'd likeness of shrunk death</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shalt continue two and forty hours,</div>
                     <div class="line">And then awake as from a pleasant sleep.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, when the bridegroom in the morning comes</div>
                     <div class="line">To rouse thee from thy bed, there art thou dead:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, as the manner of our country is,</div>
                     <div class="line">In thy best robes uncover'd on the bier</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shalt be borne to that same ancient vault</div>
                     <div class="line">Where all the kindred of the Capulets lie.</div>
                     <div class="line">In the mean time, against thou shalt awake,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall Romeo by my letters know our drift,</div>
                     <div class="line">And hither shall he come: and he and I</div>
                     <div class="line">Will watch thy waking, and that very night</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall Romeo bear thee hence to Mantua.</div>
                     <div class="line">And this shall free thee from this present shame;</div>
                     <div class="line">If no inconstant toy, nor womanish fear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Abate thy valour in the acting it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me, give me! O, tell not me of fear!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold; get you gone, be strong and prosperous</div>
                     <div class="line">In this resolve: I'll send a friar with speed</div>
                     <div class="line">To Mantua, with my letters to thy lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Love give me strength! and strength shall help afford.</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, dear father!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CAPULET, LADY  CAPULET, Nurse, and two
Servingmen</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">So many guests invite as here are writ.</div>
                     <p>Exit First Servant</p>
                     <div class="line">Sirrah, go hire me twenty cunning cooks.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">You shall have none ill, sir; for I'll try if they</div>
                     <div class="line">can lick their fingers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">How canst thou try them so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, sir, 'tis an ill cook that cannot lick his</div>
                     <div class="line">own fingers: therefore he that cannot lick his</div>
                     <div class="line">fingers goes not with me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, be gone.</div>
                     <p>Exit Second Servant</p>
                     <div class="line">We shall be much unfurnished for this time.</div>
                     <div class="line">What, is my daughter gone to Friar Laurence?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, forsooth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, he may chance to do some good on her:</div>
                     <div class="line">A peevish self-will'd harlotry it is.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">See where she comes from shrift with merry look.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter JULIET</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, my headstrong! where have you been gadding?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Where I have learn'd me to repent the sin</div>
                     <div class="line">Of disobedient opposition</div>
                     <div class="line">To you and your behests, and am enjoin'd</div>
                     <div class="line">By holy Laurence to fall prostrate here,</div>
                     <div class="line">And beg your pardon: pardon, I beseech you!</div>
                     <div class="line">Henceforward I am ever ruled by you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Send for the county; go tell him of this:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll have this knot knit up to-morrow morning.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">I met the youthful lord at Laurence' cell;</div>
                     <div class="line">And gave him what becomed love I might,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not step o'er the bounds of modesty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, I am glad on't; this is well: stand up:</div>
                     <div class="line">This is as't should be. Let me see the county;</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, marry, go, I say, and fetch him hither.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, afore God! this reverend holy friar,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our whole city is much bound to him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Nurse, will you go with me into my closet,</div>
                     <div class="line">To help me sort such needful ornaments</div>
                     <div class="line">As you think fit to furnish me to-morrow?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">No, not till Thursday; there is time enough.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, nurse, go with her: we'll to church to-morrow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt JULIET and Nurse</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY  CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">We shall be short in our provision:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis now near night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Tush, I will stir about,</div>
                     <div class="line">And all things shall be well, I warrant thee, wife:</div>
                     <div class="line">Go thou to Juliet, help to deck up her;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll not to bed to-night; let me alone;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll play the housewife for this once. What, ho!</div>
                     <div class="line">They are all forth. Well, I will walk myself</div>
                     <div class="line">To County Paris, to prepare him up</div>
                     <div class="line">Against to-morrow: my heart is wondrous light,</div>
                     <div class="line">Since this same wayward girl is so reclaim'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  Juliet's chamber.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter JULIET and Nurse</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, those attires are best: but, gentle nurse,</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray thee, leave me to myself to-night,</div>
                     <div class="line">For I have need of many orisons</div>
                     <div class="line">To move the heavens to smile upon my state,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, well thou know'st, is cross, and full of sin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter LADY CAPULET</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">What, are you busy, ho? need you my help?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">No, madam; we have cull'd such necessaries</div>
                     <div class="line">As are behoveful for our state to-morrow:</div>
                     <div class="line">So please you, let me now be left alone,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let the nurse this night sit up with you;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, I am sure, you have your hands full all,</div>
                     <div class="line">In this so sudden business.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Good night:</div>
                     <div class="line">Get thee to bed, and rest; for thou hast need.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt LADY CAPULET and Nurse</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell! God knows when we shall meet again.</div>
                     <div class="line">I have a faint cold fear thrills through my veins,</div>
                     <div class="line">That almost freezes up the heat of life:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll call them back again to comfort me:</div>
                     <div class="line">Nurse! What should she do here?</div>
                     <div class="line">My dismal scene I needs must act alone.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, vial.</div>
                     <div class="line">What if this mixture do not work at all?</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall I be married then to-morrow morning?</div>
                     <div class="line">No, no: this shall forbid it: lie thou there.</div>
                     <p>Laying down her dagger</p>
                     <div class="line">What if it be a poison, which the friar</div>
                     <div class="line">Subtly hath minister'd to have me dead,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest in this marriage he should be dishonour'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because he married me before to Romeo?</div>
                     <div class="line">I fear it is: and yet, methinks, it should not,</div>
                     <div class="line">For he hath still been tried a holy man.</div>
                     <div class="line">How if, when I am laid into the tomb,</div>
                     <div class="line">I wake before the time that Romeo</div>
                     <div class="line">Come to redeem me? there's a fearful point!</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall I not, then, be stifled in the vault,</div>
                     <div class="line">To whose foul mouth no healthsome air breathes in,</div>
                     <div class="line">And there die strangled ere my Romeo comes?</div>
                     <div class="line">Or, if I live, is it not very like,</div>
                     <div class="line">The horrible conceit of death and night,</div>
                     <div class="line">Together with the terror of the place,--</div>
                     <div class="line">As in a vault, an ancient receptacle,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where, for these many hundred years, the bones</div>
                     <div class="line">Of all my buried ancestors are packed:</div>
                     <div class="line">Where bloody Tybalt, yet but green in earth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lies festering in his shroud; where, as they say,</div>
                     <div class="line">At some hours in the night spirits resort;--</div>
                     <div class="line">Alack, alack, is it not like that I,</div>
                     <div class="line">So early waking, what with loathsome smells,</div>
                     <div class="line">And shrieks like mandrakes' torn out of the earth,</div>
                     <div class="line">That living mortals, hearing them, run mad:--</div>
                     <div class="line">O, if I wake, shall I not be distraught,</div>
                     <div class="line">Environed with all these hideous fears?</div>
                     <div class="line">And madly play with my forefather's joints?</div>
                     <div class="line">And pluck the mangled Tybalt from his shroud?</div>
                     <div class="line">And, in this rage, with some great kinsman's bone,</div>
                     <div class="line">As with a club, dash out my desperate brains?</div>
                     <div class="line">O, look! methinks I see my cousin's ghost</div>
                     <div class="line">Seeking out Romeo, that did spit his body</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon a rapier's point: stay, Tybalt, stay!</div>
                     <div class="line">Romeo, I come! this do I drink to thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>She falls upon her bed, within the curtains</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter LADY CAPULET and Nurse</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold, take these keys, and fetch more spices, nurse.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">They call for dates and quinces in the pastry.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CAPULET</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, stir, stir, stir! the second cock hath crow'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">The curfew-bell hath rung, 'tis three o'clock:</div>
                     <div class="line">Look to the baked meats, good Angelica:</div>
                     <div class="line">Spare not for the cost.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, you cot-quean, go,</div>
                     <div class="line">Get you to bed; faith, You'll be sick to-morrow</div>
                     <div class="line">For this night's watching.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">No, not a whit: what! I have watch'd ere now</div>
                     <div class="line">All night for lesser cause, and ne'er been sick.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, you have been a mouse-hunt in your time;</div>
                     <div class="line">But I will watch you from such watching now.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt LADY CAPULET and Nurse</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">A jealous hood, a jealous hood!</div>
                     <p>Enter three or four Servingmen, with spits, logs,
and baskets</p>
                     <div class="line">Now, fellow,</div>
                     <div class="line">What's there?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Things for the cook, sir; but I know not what.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Make haste, make haste.</div>
                     <p>Exit First Servant</p>
                     <div class="line">Sirrah, fetch drier logs:</div>
                     <div class="line">Call Peter, he will show thee where they are.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">I have a head, sir, that will find out logs,</div>
                     <div class="line">And never trouble Peter for the matter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Mass, and well said; a merry whoreson, ha!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shalt be logger-head. Good faith, 'tis day:</div>
                     <div class="line">The county will be here with music straight,</div>
                     <div class="line">For so he said he would: I hear him near.</div>
                     <p>Music within</p>
                     <div class="line">Nurse! Wife! What, ho! What, nurse, I say!</div>
                     <p>Re-enter Nurse</p>
                     <div class="line">Go waken Juliet, go and trim her up;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll go and chat with Paris: hie, make haste,</div>
                     <div class="line">Make haste; the bridegroom he is come already:</div>
                     <div class="line">Make haste, I say.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.6">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>5. SCENE V.  Juliet's chamber.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Nurse</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">Mistress! what, mistress! Juliet! fast, I warrant her, she:</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, lamb! why, lady! fie, you slug-a-bed!</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, love, I say! madam! sweet-heart! why, bride!</div>
                     <div class="line">What, not a word? you take your pennyworths now;</div>
                     <div class="line">Sleep for a week; for the next night, I warrant,</div>
                     <div class="line">The County Paris hath set up his rest,</div>
                     <div class="line">That you shall rest but little. God forgive me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, and amen, how sound is she asleep!</div>
                     <div class="line">I must needs wake her. Madam, madam, madam!</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, let the county take you in your bed;</div>
                     <div class="line">He'll fright you up, i' faith. Will it not be?</div>
                     <p>Undraws the curtains</p>
                     <div class="line">What, dress'd! and in your clothes! and down again!</div>
                     <div class="line">I must needs wake you; Lady! lady! lady!</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, alas! Help, help! my lady's dead!</div>
                     <div class="line">O, well-a-day, that ever I was born!</div>
                     <div class="line">Some aqua vitae, ho! My lord! my lady!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter LADY CAPULET</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">What noise is here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">O lamentable day!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">What is the matter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">Look, look! O heavy day!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">O me, O me! My child, my only life,</div>
                     <div class="line">Revive, look up, or I will die with thee!</div>
                     <div class="line">Help, help! Call help.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CAPULET</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">For shame, bring Juliet forth; her lord is come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">She's dead, deceased, she's dead; alack the day!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Alack the day, she's dead, she's dead, she's dead!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha! let me see her: out, alas! she's cold:</div>
                     <div class="line">Her blood is settled, and her joints are stiff;</div>
                     <div class="line">Life and these lips have long been separated:</div>
                     <div class="line">Death lies on her like an untimely frost</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the sweetest flower of all the field.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">O lamentable day!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">O woful time!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Death, that hath ta'en her hence to make me wail,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ties up my tongue, and will not let me speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter FRIAR LAURENCE and PARIS, with Musicians</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, is the bride ready to go to church?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ready to go, but never to return.</div>
                     <div class="line">O son! the night before thy wedding-day</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath Death lain with thy wife. There she lies,</div>
                     <div class="line">Flower as she was, deflowered by him.</div>
                     <div class="line">Death is my son-in-law, Death is my heir;</div>
                     <div class="line">My daughter he hath wedded: I will die,</div>
                     <div class="line">And leave him all; life, living, all is Death's.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Have I thought long to see this morning's face,</div>
                     <div class="line">And doth it give me such a sight as this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Accursed, unhappy, wretched, hateful day!</div>
                     <div class="line">Most miserable hour that e'er time saw</div>
                     <div class="line">In lasting labour of his pilgrimage!</div>
                     <div class="line">But one, poor one, one poor and loving child,</div>
                     <div class="line">But one thing to rejoice and solace in,</div>
                     <div class="line">And cruel death hath catch'd it from my sight!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">O woe! O woful, woful, woful day!</div>
                     <div class="line">Most lamentable day, most woful day,</div>
                     <div class="line">That ever, ever, I did yet behold!</div>
                     <div class="line">O day! O day! O day! O hateful day!</div>
                     <div class="line">Never was seen so black a day as this:</div>
                     <div class="line">O woful day, O woful day!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Beguiled, divorced, wronged, spited, slain!</div>
                     <div class="line">Most detestable death, by thee beguil'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">By cruel cruel thee quite overthrown!</div>
                     <div class="line">O love! O life! not life, but love in death!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">Despised, distressed, hated, martyr'd, kill'd!</div>
                     <div class="line">Uncomfortable time, why camest thou now</div>
                     <div class="line">To murder, murder our solemnity?</div>
                     <div class="line">O child! O child! my soul, and not my child!</div>
                     <div class="line">Dead art thou! Alack! my child is dead;</div>
                     <div class="line">And with my child my joys are buried.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, ho, for shame! confusion's cure lives not</div>
                     <div class="line">In these confusions. Heaven and yourself</div>
                     <div class="line">Had part in this fair maid; now heaven hath all,</div>
                     <div class="line">And all the better is it for the maid:</div>
                     <div class="line">Your part in her you could not keep from death,</div>
                     <div class="line">But heaven keeps his part in eternal life.</div>
                     <div class="line">The most you sought was her promotion;</div>
                     <div class="line">For 'twas your heaven she should be advanced:</div>
                     <div class="line">And weep ye now, seeing she is advanced</div>
                     <div class="line">Above the clouds, as high as heaven itself?</div>
                     <div class="line">O, in this love, you love your child so ill,</div>
                     <div class="line">That you run mad, seeing that she is well:</div>
                     <div class="line">She's not well married that lives married long;</div>
                     <div class="line">But she's best married that dies married young.</div>
                     <div class="line">Dry up your tears, and stick your rosemary</div>
                     <div class="line">On this fair corse; and, as the custom is,</div>
                     <div class="line">In all her best array bear her to church:</div>
                     <div class="line">For though fond nature bids us an lament,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet nature's tears are reason's merriment.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">All things that we ordained festival,</div>
                     <div class="line">Turn from their office to black funeral;</div>
                     <div class="line">Our instruments to melancholy bells,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our wedding cheer to a sad burial feast,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our solemn hymns to sullen dirges change,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our bridal flowers serve for a buried corse,</div>
                     <div class="line">And all things change them to the contrary.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, go you in; and, madam, go with him;</div>
                     <div class="line">And go, Sir Paris; every one prepare</div>
                     <div class="line">To follow this fair corse unto her grave:</div>
                     <div class="line">The heavens do lour upon you for some ill;</div>
                     <div class="line">Move them no more by crossing their high will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt CAPULET, LADY CAPULET, PARIS, and FRIAR LAURENCE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Musician</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, we may put up our pipes, and be gone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                     <div class="line">Honest goodfellows, ah, put up, put up;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, well you know, this is a pitiful case.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Musician</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, by my troth, the case may be amended.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PETER</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETER</div>
                     <div class="line">Musicians, O, musicians, 'Heart's ease, Heart's</div>
                     <div class="line">ease:' O, an you will have me live, play 'Heart's ease.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Musician</div>
                     <div class="line">Why 'Heart's ease?'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETER</div>
                     <div class="line">O, musicians, because my heart itself plays 'My</div>
                     <div class="line">heart is full of woe:' O, play me some merry dump,</div>
                     <div class="line">to comfort me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Musician</div>
                     <div class="line">Not a dump we; 'tis no time to play now.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETER</div>
                     <div class="line">You will not, then?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Musician</div>
                     <div class="line">No.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETER</div>
                     <div class="line">I will then give it you soundly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Musician</div>
                     <div class="line">What will you give us?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETER</div>
                     <div class="line">No money, on my faith, but the gleek;</div>
                     <div class="line">I will give you the minstrel.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Musician</div>
                     <div class="line">Then I will give you the serving-creature.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETER</div>
                     <div class="line">Then will I lay the serving-creature's dagger on</div>
                     <div class="line">your pate. I will carry no crotchets: I'll re you,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll fa you; do you note me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Musician</div>
                     <div class="line">An you re us and fa us, you note us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Musician</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray you, put up your dagger, and put out your wit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETER</div>
                     <div class="line">Then have at you with my wit! I will dry-beat you</div>
                     <div class="line">with an iron wit, and put up my iron dagger. Answer</div>
                     <div class="line">me like men:</div>
                     <div class="line">'When griping grief the heart doth wound,</div>
                     <div class="line">And doleful dumps the mind oppress,</div>
                     <div class="line">Then music with her silver sound'--</div>
                     <div class="line">why 'silver sound'? why 'music with her silver</div>
                     <div class="line">sound'? What say you, Simon Catling?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Musician</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, sir, because silver hath a sweet sound.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETER</div>
                     <div class="line">Pretty! What say you, Hugh Rebeck?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Musician</div>
                     <div class="line">I say 'silver sound,' because musicians sound for silver.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETER</div>
                     <div class="line">Pretty too! What say you, James Soundpost?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Musician</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, I know not what to say.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETER</div>
                     <div class="line">O, I cry you mercy; you are the singer: I will say</div>
                     <div class="line">for you. It is 'music with her silver sound,'</div>
                     <div class="line">because musicians have no gold for sounding:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Then music with her silver sound</div>
                     <div class="line">With speedy help doth lend redress.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Musician</div>
                     <div class="line">What a pestilent knave is this same!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Musician</div>
                     <div class="line">Hang him, Jack! Come, we'll in here; tarry for the</div>
                     <div class="line">mourners, and stay dinner.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.7">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 5. ACT V</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  Mantua. A street.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  Friar Laurence's cell.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Mantua. A street.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ROMEO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">If I may trust the flattering truth of sleep,</div>
                     <div class="line">My dreams presage some joyful news at hand:</div>
                     <div class="line">My bosom's lord sits lightly in his throne;</div>
                     <div class="line">And all this day an unaccustom'd spirit</div>
                     <div class="line">Lifts me above the ground with cheerful thoughts.</div>
                     <div class="line">I dreamt my lady came and found me dead--</div>
                     <div class="line">Strange dream, that gives a dead man leave</div>
                     <div class="line">to think!--</div>
                     <div class="line">And breathed such life with kisses in my lips,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I revived, and was an emperor.</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah me! how sweet is love itself possess'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">When but love's shadows are so rich in joy!</div>
                     <p>Enter BALTHASAR, booted</p>
                     <div class="line">News from Verona!--How now, Balthasar!</div>
                     <div class="line">Dost thou not bring me letters from the friar?</div>
                     <div class="line">How doth my lady? Is my father well?</div>
                     <div class="line">How fares my Juliet? that I ask again;</div>
                     <div class="line">For nothing can be ill, if she be well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Then she is well, and nothing can be ill:</div>
                     <div class="line">Her body sleeps in Capel's monument,</div>
                     <div class="line">And her immortal part with angels lives.</div>
                     <div class="line">I saw her laid low in her kindred's vault,</div>
                     <div class="line">And presently took post to tell it you:</div>
                     <div class="line">O, pardon me for bringing these ill news,</div>
                     <div class="line">Since you did leave it for my office, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it even so? then I defy you, stars!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou know'st my lodging: get me ink and paper,</div>
                     <div class="line">And hire post-horses; I will hence to-night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                     <div class="line">I do beseech you, sir, have patience:</div>
                     <div class="line">Your looks are pale and wild, and do import</div>
                     <div class="line">Some misadventure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Tush, thou art deceived:</div>
                     <div class="line">Leave me, and do the thing I bid thee do.</div>
                     <div class="line">Hast thou no letters to me from the friar?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                     <div class="line">No, my good lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">No matter: get thee gone,</div>
                     <div class="line">And hire those horses; I'll be with thee straight.</div>
                     <p>Exit BALTHASAR</p>
                     <div class="line">Well, Juliet, I will lie with thee to-night.</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's see for means: O mischief, thou art swift</div>
                     <div class="line">To enter in the thoughts of desperate men!</div>
                     <div class="line">I do remember an apothecary,--</div>
                     <div class="line">And hereabouts he dwells,--which late I noted</div>
                     <div class="line">In tatter'd weeds, with overwhelming brows,</div>
                     <div class="line">Culling of simples; meagre were his looks,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sharp misery had worn him to the bones:</div>
                     <div class="line">And in his needy shop a tortoise hung,</div>
                     <div class="line">An alligator stuff'd, and other skins</div>
                     <div class="line">Of ill-shaped fishes; and about his shelves</div>
                     <div class="line">A beggarly account of empty boxes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Green earthen pots, bladders and musty seeds,</div>
                     <div class="line">Remnants of packthread and old cakes of roses,</div>
                     <div class="line">Were thinly scatter'd, to make up a show.</div>
                     <div class="line">Noting this penury, to myself I said</div>
                     <div class="line">'An if a man did need a poison now,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose sale is present death in Mantua,</div>
                     <div class="line">Here lives a caitiff wretch would sell it him.'</div>
                     <div class="line">O, this same thought did but forerun my need;</div>
                     <div class="line">And this same needy man must sell it me.</div>
                     <div class="line">As I remember, this should be the house.</div>
                     <div class="line">Being holiday, the beggar's shop is shut.</div>
                     <div class="line">What, ho! apothecary!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Apothecary</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Apothecary</div>
                     <div class="line">Who calls so loud?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Come hither, man. I see that thou art poor:</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold, there is forty ducats: let me have</div>
                     <div class="line">A dram of poison, such soon-speeding gear</div>
                     <div class="line">As will disperse itself through all the veins</div>
                     <div class="line">That the life-weary taker may fall dead</div>
                     <div class="line">And that the trunk may be discharged of breath</div>
                     <div class="line">As violently as hasty powder fired</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth hurry from the fatal cannon's womb.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Apothecary</div>
                     <div class="line">Such mortal drugs I have; but Mantua's law</div>
                     <div class="line">Is death to any he that utters them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Art thou so bare and full of wretchedness,</div>
                     <div class="line">And fear'st to die? famine is in thy cheeks,</div>
                     <div class="line">Need and oppression starveth in thine eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Contempt and beggary hangs upon thy back;</div>
                     <div class="line">The world is not thy friend nor the world's law;</div>
                     <div class="line">The world affords no law to make thee rich;</div>
                     <div class="line">Then be not poor, but break it, and take this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Apothecary</div>
                     <div class="line">My poverty, but not my will, consents.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">I pay thy poverty, and not thy will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Apothecary</div>
                     <div class="line">Put this in any liquid thing you will,</div>
                     <div class="line">And drink it off; and, if you had the strength</div>
                     <div class="line">Of twenty men, it would dispatch you straight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">There is thy gold, worse poison to men's souls,</div>
                     <div class="line">Doing more murders in this loathsome world,</div>
                     <div class="line">Than these poor compounds that thou mayst not sell.</div>
                     <div class="line">I sell thee poison; thou hast sold me none.</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell: buy food, and get thyself in flesh.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, cordial and not poison, go with me</div>
                     <div class="line">To Juliet's grave; for there must I use thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
