               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Friar Laurence's cell.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter FRIAR JOHN</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Holy Franciscan friar! brother, ho!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter FRIAR LAURENCE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">This same should be the voice of Friar John.</div>
                     <div class="line">Welcome from Mantua: what says Romeo?</div>
                     <div class="line">Or, if his mind be writ, give me his letter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Going to find a bare-foot brother out</div>
                     <div class="line">One of our order, to associate me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Here in this city visiting the sick,</div>
                     <div class="line">And finding him, the searchers of the town,</div>
                     <div class="line">Suspecting that we both were in a house</div>
                     <div class="line">Where the infectious pestilence did reign,</div>
                     <div class="line">Seal'd up the doors, and would not let us forth;</div>
                     <div class="line">So that my speed to Mantua there was stay'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Who bare my letter, then, to Romeo?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">I could not send it,--here it is again,--</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor get a messenger to bring it thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">So fearful were they of infection.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Unhappy fortune! by my brotherhood,</div>
                     <div class="line">The letter was not nice but full of charge</div>
                     <div class="line">Of dear import, and the neglecting it</div>
                     <div class="line">May do much danger. Friar John, go hence;</div>
                     <div class="line">Get me an iron crow, and bring it straight</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto my cell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Brother, I'll go and bring it thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Now must I to the monument alone;</div>
                     <div class="line">Within three hours will fair Juliet wake:</div>
                     <div class="line">She will beshrew me much that Romeo</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath had no notice of these accidents;</div>
                     <div class="line">But I will write again to Mantua,</div>
                     <div class="line">And keep her at my cell till Romeo come;</div>
                     <div class="line">Poor living corse, closed in a dead man's tomb!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PARIS, and his Page bearing flowers and a torch</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me thy torch, boy: hence, and stand aloof:</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet put it out, for I would not be seen.</div>
                     <div class="line">Under yond yew-trees lay thee all along,</div>
                     <div class="line">Holding thine ear close to the hollow ground;</div>
                     <div class="line">So shall no foot upon the churchyard tread,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being loose, unfirm, with digging up of graves,</div>
                     <div class="line">But thou shalt hear it: whistle then to me,</div>
                     <div class="line">As signal that thou hear'st something approach.</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me those flowers. Do as I bid thee, go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  I am almost afraid to stand alone</div>
                     <div class="line">Here in the churchyard; yet I will adventure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Retires</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet flower, with flowers thy bridal bed I strew,--</div>
                     <div class="line">O woe! thy canopy is dust and stones;--</div>
                     <div class="line">Which with sweet water nightly I will dew,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or, wanting that, with tears distill'd by moans:</div>
                     <div class="line">The obsequies that I for thee will keep</div>
                     <div class="line">Nightly shall be to strew thy grave and weep.</div>
                     <p>The Page whistles</p>
                     <div class="line">The boy gives warning something doth approach.</div>
                     <div class="line">What cursed foot wanders this way to-night,</div>
                     <div class="line">To cross my obsequies and true love's rite?</div>
                     <div class="line">What with a torch! muffle me, night, awhile.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Retires</p>
               <p>Enter ROMEO and BALTHASAR, with a torch,
mattock, &c</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me that mattock and the wrenching iron.</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold, take this letter; early in the morning</div>
                     <div class="line">See thou deliver it to my lord and father.</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me the light: upon thy life, I charge thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whate'er thou hear'st or seest, stand all aloof,</div>
                     <div class="line">And do not interrupt me in my course.</div>
                     <div class="line">Why I descend into this bed of death,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is partly to behold my lady's face;</div>
                     <div class="line">But chiefly to take thence from her dead finger</div>
                     <div class="line">A precious ring, a ring that I must use</div>
                     <div class="line">In dear employment: therefore hence, be gone:</div>
                     <div class="line">But if thou, jealous, dost return to pry</div>
                     <div class="line">In what I further shall intend to do,</div>
                     <div class="line">By heaven, I will tear thee joint by joint</div>
                     <div class="line">And strew this hungry churchyard with thy limbs:</div>
                     <div class="line">The time and my intents are savage-wild,</div>
                     <div class="line">More fierce and more inexorable far</div>
                     <div class="line">Than empty tigers or the roaring sea.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                     <div class="line">I will be gone, sir, and not trouble you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">So shalt thou show me friendship. Take thou that:</div>
                     <div class="line">Live, and be prosperous: and farewell, good fellow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  For all this same, I'll hide me hereabout:</div>
                     <div class="line">His looks I fear, and his intents I doubt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Retires</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou detestable maw, thou womb of death,</div>
                     <div class="line">Gorged with the dearest morsel of the earth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus I enforce thy rotten jaws to open,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, in despite, I'll cram thee with more food!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Opens the tomb</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">This is that banish'd haughty Montague,</div>
                     <div class="line">That murder'd my love's cousin, with which grief,</div>
                     <div class="line">It is supposed, the fair creature died;</div>
                     <div class="line">And here is come to do some villanous shame</div>
                     <div class="line">To the dead bodies: I will apprehend him.</div>
                     <p>Comes forward</p>
                     <div class="line">Stop thy unhallow'd toil, vile Montague!</div>
                     <div class="line">Can vengeance be pursued further than death?</div>
                     <div class="line">Condemned villain, I do apprehend thee:</div>
                     <div class="line">Obey, and go with me; for thou must die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">I must indeed; and therefore came I hither.</div>
                     <div class="line">Good gentle youth, tempt not a desperate man;</div>
                     <div class="line">Fly hence, and leave me: think upon these gone;</div>
                     <div class="line">Let them affright thee. I beseech thee, youth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Put not another sin upon my head,</div>
                     <div class="line">By urging me to fury: O, be gone!</div>
                     <div class="line">By heaven, I love thee better than myself;</div>
                     <div class="line">For I come hither arm'd against myself:</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay not, be gone; live, and hereafter say,</div>
                     <div class="line">A madman's mercy bade thee run away.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">I do defy thy conjurations,</div>
                     <div class="line">And apprehend thee for a felon here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">Wilt thou provoke me? then have at thee, boy!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>They fight</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">O Lord, they fight! I will go call the watch.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                     <div class="line">O, I am slain!</div>
                     <p>Falls</p>
                     <div class="line">If thou be merciful,</div>
                     <div class="line">Open the tomb, lay me with Juliet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Dies</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                     <div class="line">In faith, I will. Let me peruse this face.</div>
                     <div class="line">Mercutio's kinsman, noble County Paris!</div>
                     <div class="line">What said my man, when my betossed soul</div>
                     <div class="line">Did not attend him as we rode? I think</div>
                     <div class="line">He told me Paris should have married Juliet:</div>
                     <div class="line">Said he not so? or did I dream it so?</div>
                     <div class="line">Or am I mad, hearing him talk of Juliet,</div>
                     <div class="line">To think it was so? O, give me thy hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">One writ with me in sour misfortune's book!</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll bury thee in a triumphant grave;</div>
                     <div class="line">A grave? O no! a lantern, slaughter'd youth,</div>
                     <div class="line">For here lies Juliet, and her beauty makes</div>
                     <div class="line">This vault a feasting presence full of light.</div>
                     <div class="line">Death, lie thou there, by a dead man interr'd.</div>
                     <p>Laying PARIS in the tomb</p>
                     <div class="line">How oft when men are at the point of death</div>
                     <div class="line">Have they been merry! which their keepers call</div>
                     <div class="line">A lightning before death: O, how may I</div>
                     <div class="line">Call this a lightning? O my love! my wife!</div>
                     <div class="line">Death, that hath suck'd the honey of thy breath,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath had no power yet upon thy beauty:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art not conquer'd; beauty's ensign yet</div>
                     <div class="line">Is crimson in thy lips and in thy cheeks,</div>
                     <div class="line">And death's pale flag is not advanced there.</div>
                     <div class="line">Tybalt, liest thou there in thy bloody sheet?</div>
                     <div class="line">O, what more favour can I do to thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Than with that hand that cut thy youth in twain</div>
                     <div class="line">To sunder his that was thine enemy?</div>
                     <div class="line">Forgive me, cousin! Ah, dear Juliet,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why art thou yet so fair? shall I believe</div>
                     <div class="line">That unsubstantial death is amorous,</div>
                     <div class="line">And that the lean abhorred monster keeps</div>
                     <div class="line">Thee here in dark to be his paramour?</div>
                     <div class="line">For fear of that, I still will stay with thee;</div>
                     <div class="line">And never from this palace of dim night</div>
                     <div class="line">Depart again: here, here will I remain</div>
                     <div class="line">With worms that are thy chamber-maids; O, here</div>
                     <div class="line">Will I set up my everlasting rest,</div>
                     <div class="line">And shake the yoke of inauspicious stars</div>
                     <div class="line">From this world-wearied flesh. Eyes, look your last!</div>
                     <div class="line">Arms, take your last embrace! and, lips, O you</div>
                     <div class="line">The doors of breath, seal with a righteous kiss</div>
                     <div class="line">A dateless bargain to engrossing death!</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, bitter conduct, come, unsavoury guide!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou desperate pilot, now at once run on</div>
                     <div class="line">The dashing rocks thy sea-sick weary bark!</div>
                     <div class="line">Here's to my love!</div>
                     <p>Drinks</p>
                     <div class="line">O true apothecary!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy drugs are quick. Thus with a kiss I die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Dies</p>
               <p>Enter, at the other end of the churchyard, FRIAR
LAURENCE, with a lantern, crow, and spade</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Saint Francis be my speed! how oft to-night</div>
                     <div class="line">Have my old feet stumbled at graves! Who's there?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Here's one, a friend, and one that knows you well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Bliss be upon you! Tell me, good my friend,</div>
                     <div class="line">What torch is yond, that vainly lends his light</div>
                     <div class="line">To grubs and eyeless skulls? as I discern,</div>
                     <div class="line">It burneth in the Capel's monument.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                     <div class="line">It doth so, holy sir; and there's my master,</div>
                     <div class="line">One that you love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Who is it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Romeo.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">How long hath he been there?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                     <div class="line">Full half an hour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Go with me to the vault.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                     <div class="line">I dare not, sir</div>
                     <div class="line">My master knows not but I am gone hence;</div>
                     <div class="line">And fearfully did menace me with death,</div>
                     <div class="line">If I did stay to look on his intents.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay, then; I'll go alone. Fear comes upon me:</div>
                     <div class="line">O, much I fear some ill unlucky thing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                     <div class="line">As I did sleep under this yew-tree here,</div>
                     <div class="line">I dreamt my master and another fought,</div>
                     <div class="line">And that my master slew him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Romeo!</div>
                     <p>Advances</p>
                     <div class="line">Alack, alack, what blood is this, which stains</div>
                     <div class="line">The stony entrance of this sepulchre?</div>
                     <div class="line">What mean these masterless and gory swords</div>
                     <div class="line">To lie discolour'd by this place of peace?</div>
                     <p>Enters the tomb</p>
                     <div class="line">Romeo! O, pale! Who else? what, Paris too?</div>
                     <div class="line">And steep'd in blood? Ah, what an unkind hour</div>
                     <div class="line">Is guilty of this lamentable chance!</div>
                     <div class="line">The lady stirs.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>JULIET wakes</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">O comfortable friar! where is my lord?</div>
                     <div class="line">I do remember well where I should be,</div>
                     <div class="line">And there I am. Where is my Romeo?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Noise within</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">I hear some noise. Lady, come from that nest</div>
                     <div class="line">Of death, contagion, and unnatural sleep:</div>
                     <div class="line">A greater power than we can contradict</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath thwarted our intents. Come, come away.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy husband in thy bosom there lies dead;</div>
                     <div class="line">And Paris too. Come, I'll dispose of thee</div>
                     <div class="line">Among a sisterhood of holy nuns:</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay not to question, for the watch is coming;</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, go, good Juliet,</div>
                     <p>Noise again</p>
                     <div class="line">I dare no longer stay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, get thee hence, for I will not away.</div>
                     <p>Exit FRIAR LAURENCE</p>
                     <div class="line">What's here? a cup, closed in my true love's hand?</div>
                     <div class="line">Poison, I see, hath been his timeless end:</div>
                     <div class="line">O churl! drunk all, and left no friendly drop</div>
                     <div class="line">To help me after? I will kiss thy lips;</div>
                     <div class="line">Haply some poison yet doth hang on them,</div>
                     <div class="line">To make die with a restorative.</div>
                     <p>Kisses him</p>
                     <div class="line">Thy lips are warm.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Watchman</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  Lead, boy: which way?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, noise? then I'll be brief. O happy dagger!</div>
                     <p>Snatching ROMEO's dagger</p>
                     <div class="line">This is thy sheath;</div>
                     <p>Stabs herself</p>
                     <div class="line">there rust, and let me die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Falls on ROMEO's body, and dies</p>
               <p>Enter Watch, with the Page of PARIS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the place; there, where the torch doth burn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Watchman</div>
                     <div class="line">The ground is bloody; search about the churchyard:</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, some of you, whoe'er you find attach.</div>
                     <div class="line">Pitiful sight! here lies the county slain,</div>
                     <div class="line">And Juliet bleeding, warm, and newly dead,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who here hath lain these two days buried.</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, tell the prince: run to the Capulets:</div>
                     <div class="line">Raise up the Montagues: some others search:</div>
                     <div class="line">We see the ground whereon these woes do lie;</div>
                     <div class="line">But the true ground of all these piteous woes</div>
                     <div class="line">We cannot without circumstance descry.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter some of the Watch, with BALTHASAR</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Watchman</div>
                     <div class="line">Here's Romeo's man; we found him in the churchyard.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Watchman</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold him in safety, till the prince come hither.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter others of the Watch, with FRIAR LAURENCE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Watchman</div>
                     <div class="line">Here is a friar, that trembles, sighs and weeps:</div>
                     <div class="line">We took this mattock and this spade from him,</div>
                     <div class="line">As he was coming from this churchyard side.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Watchman</div>
                     <div class="line">A great suspicion: stay the friar too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter the PRINCE and Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">What misadventure is so early up,</div>
                     <div class="line">That calls our person from our morning's rest?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CAPULET, LADY CAPULET, and others</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">What should it be, that they so shriek abroad?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">The people in the street cry Romeo,</div>
                     <div class="line">Some Juliet, and some Paris; and all run,</div>
                     <div class="line">With open outcry toward our monument.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">What fear is this which startles in our ears?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Watchman</div>
                     <div class="line">Sovereign, here lies the County Paris slain;</div>
                     <div class="line">And Romeo dead; and Juliet, dead before,</div>
                     <div class="line">Warm and new kill'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Search, seek, and know how this foul murder comes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Watchman</div>
                     <div class="line">Here is a friar, and slaughter'd Romeo's man;</div>
                     <div class="line">With instruments upon them, fit to open</div>
                     <div class="line">These dead men's tombs.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">O heavens! O wife, look how our daughter bleeds!</div>
                     <div class="line">This dagger hath mista'en--for, lo, his house</div>
                     <div class="line">Is empty on the back of Montague,--</div>
                     <div class="line">And it mis-sheathed in my daughter's bosom!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">O me! this sight of death is as a bell,</div>
                     <div class="line">That warns my old age to a sepulchre.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter MONTAGUE and others</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, Montague; for thou art early up,</div>
                     <div class="line">To see thy son and heir more early down.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, my liege, my wife is dead to-night;</div>
                     <div class="line">Grief of my son's exile hath stopp'd her breath:</div>
                     <div class="line">What further woe conspires against mine age?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Look, and thou shalt see.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                     <div class="line">O thou untaught! what manners is in this?</div>
                     <div class="line">To press before thy father to a grave?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Seal up the mouth of outrage for a while,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till we can clear these ambiguities,</div>
                     <div class="line">And know their spring, their head, their</div>
                     <div class="line">true descent;</div>
                     <div class="line">And then will I be general of your woes,</div>
                     <div class="line">And lead you even to death: meantime forbear,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let mischance be slave to patience.</div>
                     <div class="line">Bring forth the parties of suspicion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">I am the greatest, able to do least,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet most suspected, as the time and place</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth make against me of this direful murder;</div>
                     <div class="line">And here I stand, both to impeach and purge</div>
                     <div class="line">Myself condemned and myself excused.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Then say at once what thou dost know in this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                     <div class="line">I will be brief, for my short date of breath</div>
                     <div class="line">Is not so long as is a tedious tale.</div>
                     <div class="line">Romeo, there dead, was husband to that Juliet;</div>
                     <div class="line">And she, there dead, that Romeo's faithful wife:</div>
                     <div class="line">I married them; and their stol'n marriage-day</div>
                     <div class="line">Was Tybalt's dooms-day, whose untimely death</div>
                     <div class="line">Banish'd the new-made bridegroom from the city,</div>
                     <div class="line">For whom, and not for Tybalt, Juliet pined.</div>
                     <div class="line">You, to remove that siege of grief from her,</div>
                     <div class="line">Betroth'd and would have married her perforce</div>
                     <div class="line">To County Paris: then comes she to me,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, with wild looks, bid me devise some mean</div>
                     <div class="line">To rid her from this second marriage,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or in my cell there would she kill herself.</div>
                     <div class="line">Then gave I her, so tutor'd by my art,</div>
                     <div class="line">A sleeping potion; which so took effect</div>
                     <div class="line">As I intended, for it wrought on her</div>
                     <div class="line">The form of death: meantime I writ to Romeo,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he should hither come as this dire night,</div>
                     <div class="line">To help to take her from her borrow'd grave,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being the time the potion's force should cease.</div>
                     <div class="line">But he which bore my letter, Friar John,</div>
                     <div class="line">Was stay'd by accident, and yesternight</div>
                     <div class="line">Return'd my letter back. Then all alone</div>
                     <div class="line">At the prefixed hour of her waking,</div>
                     <div class="line">Came I to take her from her kindred's vault;</div>
                     <div class="line">Meaning to keep her closely at my cell,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till I conveniently could send to Romeo:</div>
                     <div class="line">But when I came, some minute ere the time</div>
                     <div class="line">Of her awaking, here untimely lay</div>
                     <div class="line">The noble Paris and true Romeo dead.</div>
                     <div class="line">She wakes; and I entreated her come forth,</div>
                     <div class="line">And bear this work of heaven with patience:</div>
                     <div class="line">But then a noise did scare me from the tomb;</div>
                     <div class="line">And she, too desperate, would not go with me,</div>
                     <div class="line">But, as it seems, did violence on herself.</div>
                     <div class="line">All this I know; and to the marriage</div>
                     <div class="line">Her nurse is privy: and, if aught in this</div>
                     <div class="line">Miscarried by my fault, let my old life</div>
                     <div class="line">Be sacrificed, some hour before his time,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto the rigour of severest law.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">We still have known thee for a holy man.</div>
                     <div class="line">Where's Romeo's man? what can he say in this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                     <div class="line">I brought my master news of Juliet's death;</div>
                     <div class="line">And then in post he came from Mantua</div>
                     <div class="line">To this same place, to this same monument.</div>
                     <div class="line">This letter he early bid me give his father,</div>
                     <div class="line">And threatened me with death, going in the vault,</div>
                     <div class="line">I departed not and left him there.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me the letter; I will look on it.</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is the county's page, that raised the watch?</div>
                     <div class="line">Sirrah, what made your master in this place?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAGE</div>
                     <div class="line">He came with flowers to strew his lady's grave;</div>
                     <div class="line">And bid me stand aloof, and so I did:</div>
                     <div class="line">Anon comes one with light to ope the tomb;</div>
                     <div class="line">And by and by my master drew on him;</div>
                     <div class="line">And then I ran away to call the watch.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">This letter doth make good the friar's words,</div>
                     <div class="line">Their course of love, the tidings of her death:</div>
                     <div class="line">And here he writes that he did buy a poison</div>
                     <div class="line">Of a poor 'pothecary, and therewithal</div>
                     <div class="line">Came to this vault to die, and lie with Juliet.</div>
                     <div class="line">Where be these enemies? Capulet! Montague!</div>
                     <div class="line">See, what a scourge is laid upon your hate,</div>
                     <div class="line">That heaven finds means to kill your joys with love.</div>
                     <div class="line">And I for winking at your discords too</div>
                     <div class="line">Have lost a brace of kinsmen: all are punish'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">O brother Montague, give me thy hand:</div>
                     <div class="line">This is my daughter's jointure, for no more</div>
                     <div class="line">Can I demand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                     <div class="line">But I can give thee more:</div>
                     <div class="line">For I will raise her statue in pure gold;</div>
                     <div class="line">That while Verona by that name is known,</div>
                     <div class="line">There shall no figure at such rate be set</div>
                     <div class="line">As that of true and faithful Juliet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                     <div class="line">As rich shall Romeo's by his lady's lie;</div>
                     <div class="line">Poor sacrifices of our enmity!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE</div>
                     <div class="line">A glooming peace this morning with it brings;</div>
                     <div class="line">The sun, for sorrow, will not show his head:</div>
                     <div class="line">Go hence, to have more talk of these sad things;</div>
                     <div class="line">Some shall be pardon'd, and some punished:</div>
                     <div class="line">For never was a story of more woe</div>
                     <div class="line">Than this of Juliet and her Romeo.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
      </article>
      <script src="../../resources/js/prism.js"/>
   </body>
</html>
<html>
   <head>
      <link href="../../resources/css/db-prism.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <link href="../../resources/css/default.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <link href="../../resources/css/prism.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <link href="../../resources/css/publishers.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <meta charset="utf-8"/>
      <meta content="DocBook XSL 2.0 Stylesheets Vxxx" name="generator"/>
      <script src="../../resources/js/dbmodnizr.js" type="text/javascript"/>
      <title>The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet</title>
   </head>
   <body>
      <article class="book" id="R.1">
         <header class="book-titlepage">
            <h1>The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet</h1>
         </header>
         <div class="lists-of-titles">
            <div class="toc">
               <p>
                  <b>Table of Contents</b>
               </p>
               <ul class="toc">
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.2">1. Dramatis Personae</a>
                     </span>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.3">1. ACT I</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. PROLOGUE</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.4">3. SCENE II.  A street.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.5">4. SCENE III.  A room in Capulet's house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.6">5. SCENE IV.  A street.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.7">6. SCENE V.  A hall in Capulet's house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.4">2. ACT II</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. PROLOGUE</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE I.  A lane by the wall of Capulet's orchard.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.4">3. SCENE II.  Capulet's orchard.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.5">4. SCENE III.  Friar Laurence's cell.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.6">5. SCENE IV.  A street.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.7">6. SCENE V.  Capulet's orchard.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.8">7. SCENE VI.  Friar Laurence's cell.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.5">3. ACT III</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.2">1. SCENE I.  A public place.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.3">2. SCENE II.  Capulet's orchard.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.4">3. SCENE III.  Friar Laurence's cell.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.5">4. SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.5.6">5. SCENE V.  Capulet's orchard.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.6">4. ACT IV</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.2">1. SCENE I.  Friar Laurence's cell.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.3">2. SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.4">3. SCENE III.  Juliet's chamber.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.5">4. SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.6.6">5. SCENE V.  Juliet's chamber.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.7">5. ACT V</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  Mantua. A street.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  Friar Laurence's cell.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
               </ul>
            </div>
         </div>
         <div class="content">
            <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
               <header class="preface-titlepage">
                  <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="content">
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">ESCALUS, prince of Verona. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">PARIS, a young nobleman, kinsman to the prince.</span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">MONTAGUE</span>
                              <span class="personname">CAPULET</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">heads of two houses at variance with each other.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">An old man, cousin to Capulet. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">ROMEO, son to Montague.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">MERCUTIO, kinsman to the prince, and friend to Romeo.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">BENVOLIO, nephew to Montague, and friend to Romeo.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">TYBALT, nephew to Lady Capulet.</span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">FRIAR LAURENCE</span>
                              <span class="personname">FRIAR JOHN</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">Franciscans.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">BALTHASAR, servant to Romeo.</span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">SAMPSON</span>
                              <span class="personname">GREGORY</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">servants to Capulet.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">PETER, servant to Juliet's nurse.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">ABRAHAM, servant to Montague.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">An Apothecary. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Three Musicians.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Page to Paris; another Page; an officer.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">LADY MONTAGUE, wife to Montague.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">LADY CAPULET, wife to Capulet.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">JULIET, daughter to Capulet.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Nurse to Juliet. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Citizens of Verona; several Men and Women, relations to both houses; Maskers, Guards, Watchmen, and Attendants.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Chorus.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>SCENE  Verona: Mantua.</p>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. PROLOGUE</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.4">3. SCENE II.  A street.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.5">4. SCENE III.  A room in Capulet's house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.6">5. SCENE IV.  A street.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.7">6. SCENE V.  A hall in Capulet's house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. PROLOGUE</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker"/>
                              <div class="line">Two households, both alike in dignity,</div>
                              <div class="line">In fair Verona, where we lay our scene,</div>
                              <div class="line">From ancient grudge break to new mutiny,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where civil blood makes civil hands unclean.</div>
                              <div class="line">From forth the fatal loins of these two foes</div>
                              <div class="line">A pair of star-cross'd lovers take their life;</div>
                              <div class="line">Whole misadventured piteous overthrows</div>
                              <div class="line">Do with their death bury their parents' strife.</div>
                              <div class="line">The fearful passage of their death-mark'd love,</div>
                              <div class="line">And the continuance of their parents' rage,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which, but their children's end, nought could remove,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is now the two hours' traffic of our stage;</div>
                              <div class="line">The which if you with patient ears attend,</div>
                              <div class="line">What here shall miss, our toil shall strive to mend.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter SAMPSON and GREGORY, of the house of Capulet,
armed with swords and bucklers</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SAMPSON</div>
                              <div class="line">Gregory, o' my word, we'll not carry coals.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GREGORY</div>
                              <div class="line">No, for then we should be colliers.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SAMPSON</div>
                              <div class="line">I mean, an we be in choler, we'll draw.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GREGORY</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, while you live, draw your neck out o' the collar.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SAMPSON</div>
                              <div class="line">I strike quickly, being moved.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GREGORY</div>
                              <div class="line">But thou art not quickly moved to strike.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SAMPSON</div>
                              <div class="line">A dog of the house of Montague moves me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GREGORY</div>
                              <div class="line">To move is to stir; and to be valiant is to stand:</div>
                              <div class="line">therefore, if thou art moved, thou runn'st away.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SAMPSON</div>
                              <div class="line">A dog of that house shall move me to stand: I will</div>
                              <div class="line">take the wall of any man or maid of Montague's.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GREGORY</div>
                              <div class="line">That shows thee a weak slave; for the weakest goes</div>
                              <div class="line">to the wall.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SAMPSON</div>
                              <div class="line">True; and therefore women, being the weaker vessels,</div>
                              <div class="line">are ever thrust to the wall: therefore I will push</div>
                              <div class="line">Montague's men from the wall, and thrust his maids</div>
                              <div class="line">to the wall.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GREGORY</div>
                              <div class="line">The quarrel is between our masters and us their men.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SAMPSON</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis all one, I will show myself a tyrant: when I</div>
                              <div class="line">have fought with the men, I will be cruel with the</div>
                              <div class="line">maids, and cut off their heads.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GREGORY</div>
                              <div class="line">The heads of the maids?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SAMPSON</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, the heads of the maids, or their maidenheads;</div>
                              <div class="line">take it in what sense thou wilt.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GREGORY</div>
                              <div class="line">They must take it in sense that feel it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SAMPSON</div>
                              <div class="line">Me they shall feel while I am able to stand: and</div>
                              <div class="line">'tis known I am a pretty piece of flesh.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GREGORY</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis well thou art not fish; if thou hadst, thou</div>
                              <div class="line">hadst been poor John. Draw thy tool! here comes</div>
                              <div class="line">two of the house of the Montagues.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SAMPSON</div>
                              <div class="line">My naked weapon is out: quarrel, I will back thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GREGORY</div>
                              <div class="line">How! turn thy back and run?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SAMPSON</div>
                              <div class="line">Fear me not.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GREGORY</div>
                              <div class="line">No, marry; I fear thee!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SAMPSON</div>
                              <div class="line">Let us take the law of our sides; let them begin.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GREGORY</div>
                              <div class="line">I will frown as I pass by, and let them take it as</div>
                              <div class="line">they list.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SAMPSON</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, as they dare. I will bite my thumb at them;</div>
                              <div class="line">which is a disgrace to them, if they bear it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter ABRAHAM and BALTHASAR</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ABRAHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Do you bite your thumb at us, sir?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SAMPSON</div>
                              <div class="line">I do bite my thumb, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ABRAHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Do you bite your thumb at us, sir?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SAMPSON</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside to GREGORY</span>  Is the law of our side, if I say</div>
                              <div class="line">ay?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GREGORY</div>
                              <div class="line">No.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SAMPSON</div>
                              <div class="line">No, sir, I do not bite my thumb at you, sir, but I</div>
                              <div class="line">bite my thumb, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GREGORY</div>
                              <div class="line">Do you quarrel, sir?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ABRAHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Quarrel sir! no, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SAMPSON</div>
                              <div class="line">If you do, sir, I am for you: I serve as good a man as you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ABRAHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">No better.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SAMPSON</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GREGORY</div>
                              <div class="line">Say 'better:' here comes one of my master's kinsmen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SAMPSON</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, better, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ABRAHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">You lie.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SAMPSON</div>
                              <div class="line">Draw, if you be men. Gregory, remember thy swashing blow.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>They fight</p>
                        <p>Enter BENVOLIO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Part, fools!</div>
                              <div class="line">Put up your swords; you know not what you do.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Beats down their swords</p>
                        <p>Enter TYBALT</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TYBALT</div>
                              <div class="line">What, art thou drawn among these heartless hinds?</div>
                              <div class="line">Turn thee, Benvolio, look upon thy death.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I do but keep the peace: put up thy sword,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or manage it to part these men with me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TYBALT</div>
                              <div class="line">What, drawn, and talk of peace! I hate the word,</div>
                              <div class="line">As I hate hell, all Montagues, and thee:</div>
                              <div class="line">Have at thee, coward!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>They fight</p>
                        <p>Enter, several of both houses, who join the fray;
then enter Citizens, with clubs</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">Clubs, bills, and partisans! strike! beat them down!</div>
                              <div class="line">Down with the Capulets! down with the Montagues!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter CAPULET in his gown, and LADY CAPULET</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">What noise is this? Give me my long sword, ho!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
