                              <div class="line">A crutch, a crutch! why call you for a sword?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">My sword, I say! Old Montague is come,</div>
                              <div class="line">And flourishes his blade in spite of me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter MONTAGUE and LADY MONTAGUE</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou villain Capulet,--Hold me not, let me go.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY MONTAGUE</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou shalt not stir a foot to seek a foe.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter PRINCE, with Attendants</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Rebellious subjects, enemies to peace,</div>
                              <div class="line">Profaners of this neighbour-stained steel,--</div>
                              <div class="line">Will they not hear? What, ho! you men, you beasts,</div>
                              <div class="line">That quench the fire of your pernicious rage</div>
                              <div class="line">With purple fountains issuing from your veins,</div>
                              <div class="line">On pain of torture, from those bloody hands</div>
                              <div class="line">Throw your mistemper'd weapons to the ground,</div>
                              <div class="line">And hear the sentence of your moved prince.</div>
                              <div class="line">Three civil brawls, bred of an airy word,</div>
                              <div class="line">By thee, old Capulet, and Montague,</div>
                              <div class="line">Have thrice disturb'd the quiet of our streets,</div>
                              <div class="line">And made Verona's ancient citizens</div>
                              <div class="line">Cast by their grave beseeming ornaments,</div>
                              <div class="line">To wield old partisans, in hands as old,</div>
                              <div class="line">Canker'd with peace, to part your canker'd hate:</div>
                              <div class="line">If ever you disturb our streets again,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your lives shall pay the forfeit of the peace.</div>
                              <div class="line">For this time, all the rest depart away:</div>
                              <div class="line">You Capulet; shall go along with me:</div>
                              <div class="line">And, Montague, come you this afternoon,</div>
                              <div class="line">To know our further pleasure in this case,</div>
                              <div class="line">To old Free-town, our common judgment-place.</div>
                              <div class="line">Once more, on pain of death, all men depart.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt all but MONTAGUE, LADY MONTAGUE, and BENVOLIO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                              <div class="line">Who set this ancient quarrel new abroach?</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak, nephew, were you by when it began?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Here were the servants of your adversary,</div>
                              <div class="line">And yours, close fighting ere I did approach:</div>
                              <div class="line">I drew to part them: in the instant came</div>
                              <div class="line">The fiery Tybalt, with his sword prepared,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which, as he breathed defiance to my ears,</div>
                              <div class="line">He swung about his head and cut the winds,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who nothing hurt withal hiss'd him in scorn:</div>
                              <div class="line">While we were interchanging thrusts and blows,</div>
                              <div class="line">Came more and more and fought on part and part,</div>
                              <div class="line">Till the prince came, who parted either part.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY MONTAGUE</div>
                              <div class="line">O, where is Romeo? saw you him to-day?</div>
                              <div class="line">Right glad I am he was not at this fray.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, an hour before the worshipp'd sun</div>
                              <div class="line">Peer'd forth the golden window of the east,</div>
                              <div class="line">A troubled mind drave me to walk abroad;</div>
                              <div class="line">Where, underneath the grove of sycamore</div>
                              <div class="line">That westward rooteth from the city's side,</div>
                              <div class="line">So early walking did I see your son:</div>
                              <div class="line">Towards him I made, but he was ware of me</div>
                              <div class="line">And stole into the covert of the wood:</div>
                              <div class="line">I, measuring his affections by my own,</div>
                              <div class="line">That most are busied when they're most alone,</div>
                              <div class="line">Pursued my humour not pursuing his,</div>
                              <div class="line">And gladly shunn'd who gladly fled from me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                              <div class="line">Many a morning hath he there been seen,</div>
                              <div class="line">With tears augmenting the fresh morning dew.</div>
                              <div class="line">Adding to clouds more clouds with his deep sighs;</div>
                              <div class="line">But all so soon as the all-cheering sun</div>
                              <div class="line">Should in the furthest east begin to draw</div>
                              <div class="line">The shady curtains from Aurora's bed,</div>
                              <div class="line">Away from the light steals home my heavy son,</div>
                              <div class="line">And private in his chamber pens himself,</div>
                              <div class="line">Shuts up his windows, locks far daylight out</div>
                              <div class="line">And makes himself an artificial night:</div>
                              <div class="line">Black and portentous must this humour prove,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unless good counsel may the cause remove.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">My noble uncle, do you know the cause?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                              <div class="line">I neither know it nor can learn of him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Have you importuned him by any means?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                              <div class="line">Both by myself and many other friends:</div>
                              <div class="line">But he, his own affections' counsellor,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is to himself--I will not say how true--</div>
                              <div class="line">But to himself so secret and so close,</div>
                              <div class="line">So far from sounding and discovery,</div>
                              <div class="line">As is the bud bit with an envious worm,</div>
                              <div class="line">Ere he can spread his sweet leaves to the air,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or dedicate his beauty to the sun.</div>
                              <div class="line">Could we but learn from whence his sorrows grow.</div>
                              <div class="line">We would as willingly give cure as know.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter ROMEO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">See, where he comes: so please you, step aside;</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll know his grievance, or be much denied.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                              <div class="line">I would thou wert so happy by thy stay,</div>
                              <div class="line">To hear true shrift. Come, madam, let's away.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt MONTAGUE and LADY MONTAGUE</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Good-morrow, cousin.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Is the day so young?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">But new struck nine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay me! sad hours seem long.</div>
                              <div class="line">Was that my father that went hence so fast?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">It was. What sadness lengthens Romeo's hours?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Not having that, which, having, makes them short.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">In love?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Out--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Of love?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Out of her favour, where I am in love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, that love, so gentle in his view,</div>
                              <div class="line">Should be so tyrannous and rough in proof!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, that love, whose view is muffled still,</div>
                              <div class="line">Should, without eyes, see pathways to his will!</div>
                              <div class="line">Where shall we dine? O me! What fray was here?</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet tell me not, for I have heard it all.</div>
                              <div class="line">Here's much to do with hate, but more with love.</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, then, O brawling love! O loving hate!</div>
                              <div class="line">O any thing, of nothing first create!</div>
                              <div class="line">O heavy lightness! serious vanity!</div>
                              <div class="line">Mis-shapen chaos of well-seeming forms!</div>
                              <div class="line">Feather of lead, bright smoke, cold fire,</div>
                              <div class="line">sick health!</div>
                              <div class="line">Still-waking sleep, that is not what it is!</div>
                              <div class="line">This love feel I, that feel no love in this.</div>
                              <div class="line">Dost thou not laugh?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">No, coz, I rather weep.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Good heart, at what?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">At thy good heart's oppression.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, such is love's transgression.</div>
                              <div class="line">Griefs of mine own lie heavy in my breast,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which thou wilt propagate, to have it prest</div>
                              <div class="line">With more of thine: this love that thou hast shown</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth add more grief to too much of mine own.</div>
                              <div class="line">Love is a smoke raised with the fume of sighs;</div>
                              <div class="line">Being purged, a fire sparkling in lovers' eyes;</div>
                              <div class="line">Being vex'd a sea nourish'd with lovers' tears:</div>
                              <div class="line">What is it else? a madness most discreet,</div>
                              <div class="line">A choking gall and a preserving sweet.</div>
                              <div class="line">Farewell, my coz.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Soft! I will go along;</div>
                              <div class="line">An if you leave me so, you do me wrong.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Tut, I have lost myself; I am not here;</div>
                              <div class="line">This is not Romeo, he's some other where.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell me in sadness, who is that you love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">What, shall I groan and tell thee?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Groan! why, no.</div>
                              <div class="line">But sadly tell me who.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Bid a sick man in sadness make his will:</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, word ill urged to one that is so ill!</div>
                              <div class="line">In sadness, cousin, I do love a woman.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I aim'd so near, when I supposed you loved.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">A right good mark-man! And she's fair I love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">A right fair mark, fair coz, is soonest hit.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, in that hit you miss: she'll not be hit</div>
                              <div class="line">With Cupid's arrow; she hath Dian's wit;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, in strong proof of chastity well arm'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">From love's weak childish bow she lives unharm'd.</div>
                              <div class="line">She will not stay the siege of loving terms,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor bide the encounter of assailing eyes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor ope her lap to saint-seducing gold:</div>
                              <div class="line">O, she is rich in beauty, only poor,</div>
                              <div class="line">That when she dies with beauty dies her store.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Then she hath sworn that she will still live chaste?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">She hath, and in that sparing makes huge waste,</div>
                              <div class="line">For beauty starved with her severity</div>
                              <div class="line">Cuts beauty off from all posterity.</div>
                              <div class="line">She is too fair, too wise, wisely too fair,</div>
                              <div class="line">To merit bliss by making me despair:</div>
                              <div class="line">She hath forsworn to love, and in that vow</div>
                              <div class="line">Do I live dead that live to tell it now.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Be ruled by me, forget to think of her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">O, teach me how I should forget to think.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">By giving liberty unto thine eyes;</div>
                              <div class="line">Examine other beauties.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis the way</div>
                              <div class="line">To call hers exquisite, in question more:</div>
                              <div class="line">These happy masks that kiss fair ladies' brows</div>
                              <div class="line">Being black put us in mind they hide the fair;</div>
                              <div class="line">He that is strucken blind cannot forget</div>
                              <div class="line">The precious treasure of his eyesight lost:</div>
                              <div class="line">Show me a mistress that is passing fair,</div>
                              <div class="line">What doth her beauty serve, but as a note</div>
                              <div class="line">Where I may read who pass'd that passing fair?</div>
                              <div class="line">Farewell: thou canst not teach me to forget.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll pay that doctrine, or else die in debt.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE II.  A street.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter CAPULET, PARIS, and Servant</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">But Montague is bound as well as I,</div>
                              <div class="line">In penalty alike; and 'tis not hard, I think,</div>
                              <div class="line">For men so old as we to keep the peace.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                              <div class="line">Of honourable reckoning are you both;</div>
                              <div class="line">And pity 'tis you lived at odds so long.</div>
                              <div class="line">But now, my lord, what say you to my suit?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">But saying o'er what I have said before:</div>
                              <div class="line">My child is yet a stranger in the world;</div>
                              <div class="line">She hath not seen the change of fourteen years,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let two more summers wither in their pride,</div>
                              <div class="line">Ere we may think her ripe to be a bride.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                              <div class="line">Younger than she are happy mothers made.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">And too soon marr'd are those so early made.</div>
                              <div class="line">The earth hath swallow'd all my hopes but she,</div>
                              <div class="line">She is the hopeful lady of my earth:</div>
                              <div class="line">But woo her, gentle Paris, get her heart,</div>
                              <div class="line">My will to her consent is but a part;</div>
                              <div class="line">An she agree, within her scope of choice</div>
                              <div class="line">Lies my consent and fair according voice.</div>
                              <div class="line">This night I hold an old accustom'd feast,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whereto I have invited many a guest,</div>
                              <div class="line">Such as I love; and you, among the store,</div>
                              <div class="line">One more, most welcome, makes my number more.</div>
                              <div class="line">At my poor house look to behold this night</div>
                              <div class="line">Earth-treading stars that make dark heaven light:</div>
                              <div class="line">Such comfort as do lusty young men feel</div>
                              <div class="line">When well-apparell'd April on the heel</div>
                              <div class="line">Of limping winter treads, even such delight</div>
                              <div class="line">Among fresh female buds shall you this night</div>
                              <div class="line">Inherit at my house; hear all, all see,</div>
                              <div class="line">And like her most whose merit most shall be:</div>
                              <div class="line">Which on more view, of many mine being one</div>
                              <div class="line">May stand in number, though in reckoning none,</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, go with me.</div>
                              <p>To Servant, giving a paper</p>
                              <div class="line">Go, sirrah, trudge about</div>
                              <div class="line">Through fair Verona; find those persons out</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose names are written there, and to them say,</div>
                              <div class="line">My house and welcome on their pleasure stay.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt CAPULET and PARIS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                              <div class="line">Find them out whose names are written here! It is</div>
                              <div class="line">written, that the shoemaker should meddle with his</div>
                              <div class="line">yard, and the tailor with his last, the fisher with</div>
                              <div class="line">his pencil, and the painter with his nets; but I am</div>
                              <div class="line">sent to find those persons whose names are here</div>
                              <div class="line">writ, and can never find what names the writing</div>
                              <div class="line">person hath here writ. I must to the learned.--In good time.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter BENVOLIO and ROMEO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Tut, man, one fire burns out another's burning,</div>
                              <div class="line">One pain is lessen'd by another's anguish;</div>
                              <div class="line">Turn giddy, and be holp by backward turning;</div>
                              <div class="line">One desperate grief cures with another's languish:</div>
                              <div class="line">Take thou some new infection to thy eye,</div>
                              <div class="line">And the rank poison of the old will die.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Your plaintain-leaf is excellent for that.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">For what, I pray thee?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">For your broken shin.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, Romeo, art thou mad?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Not mad, but bound more than a mad-man is;</div>
                              <div class="line">Shut up in prison, kept without my food,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whipp'd and tormented and--God-den, good fellow.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                              <div class="line">God gi' god-den. I pray, sir, can you read?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, mine own fortune in my misery.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                              <div class="line">Perhaps you have learned it without book: but, I</div>
                              <div class="line">pray, can you read any thing you see?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, if I know the letters and the language.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                              <div class="line">Ye say honestly: rest you merry!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Stay, fellow; I can read.</div>
                              <p>Reads</p>
                              <div class="line">'Signior Martino and his wife and daughters;</div>
                              <div class="line">County Anselme and his beauteous sisters; the lady</div>
                              <div class="line">widow of Vitravio; Signior Placentio and his lovely</div>
                              <div class="line">nieces; Mercutio and his brother Valentine; mine</div>
                              <div class="line">uncle Capulet, his wife and daughters; my fair niece</div>
                              <div class="line">Rosaline; Livia; Signior Valentio and his cousin</div>
                              <div class="line">Tybalt, Lucio and the lively Helena.' A fair</div>
                              <div class="line">assembly: whither should they come?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                              <div class="line">Up.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Whither?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                              <div class="line">To supper; to our house.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose house?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                              <div class="line">My master's.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Indeed, I should have ask'd you that before.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                              <div class="line">Now I'll tell you without asking: my master is the</div>
                              <div class="line">great rich Capulet; and if you be not of the house</div>
                              <div class="line">of Montagues, I pray, come and crush a cup of wine.</div>
                              <div class="line">Rest you merry!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">At this same ancient feast of Capulet's</div>
                              <div class="line">Sups the fair Rosaline whom thou so lovest,</div>
                              <div class="line">With all the admired beauties of Verona:</div>
                              <div class="line">Go thither; and, with unattainted eye,</div>
                              <div class="line">Compare her face with some that I shall show,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I will make thee think thy swan a crow.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">When the devout religion of mine eye</div>
                              <div class="line">Maintains such falsehood, then turn tears to fires;</div>
                              <div class="line">And these, who often drown'd could never die,</div>
                              <div class="line">Transparent heretics, be burnt for liars!</div>
                              <div class="line">One fairer than my love! the all-seeing sun</div>
                              <div class="line">Ne'er saw her match since first the world begun.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Tut, you saw her fair, none else being by,</div>
                              <div class="line">Herself poised with herself in either eye:</div>
                              <div class="line">But in that crystal scales let there be weigh'd</div>
                              <div class="line">Your lady's love against some other maid</div>
                              <div class="line">That I will show you shining at this feast,</div>
                              <div class="line">And she shall scant show well that now shows best.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll go along, no such sight to be shown,</div>
                              <div class="line">But to rejoice in splendor of mine own.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.5">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>4. SCENE III.  A room in Capulet's house.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter LADY CAPULET and Nurse</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">Nurse, where's my daughter? call her forth to me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, by my maidenhead, at twelve year old,</div>
                              <div class="line">I bade her come. What, lamb! what, ladybird!</div>
                              <div class="line">God forbid! Where's this girl? What, Juliet!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter JULIET</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                              <div class="line">How now! who calls?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                              <div class="line">Your mother.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, I am here.</div>
                              <div class="line">What is your will?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">This is the matter:--Nurse, give leave awhile,</div>
                              <div class="line">We must talk in secret:--nurse, come back again;</div>
                              <div class="line">I have remember'd me, thou's hear our counsel.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou know'st my daughter's of a pretty age.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                              <div class="line">Faith, I can tell her age unto an hour.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">She's not fourteen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll lay fourteen of my teeth,--</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet, to my teeth be it spoken, I have but four--</div>
                              <div class="line">She is not fourteen. How long is it now</div>
                              <div class="line">To Lammas-tide?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">A fortnight and odd days.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                              <div class="line">Even or odd, of all days in the year,</div>
                              <div class="line">Come Lammas-eve at night shall she be fourteen.</div>
                              <div class="line">Susan and she--God rest all Christian souls!--</div>
                              <div class="line">Were of an age: well, Susan is with God;</div>
                              <div class="line">She was too good for me: but, as I said,</div>
                              <div class="line">On Lammas-eve at night shall she be fourteen;</div>
                              <div class="line">That shall she, marry; I remember it well.</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis since the earthquake now eleven years;</div>
                              <div class="line">And she was wean'd,--I never shall forget it,--</div>
                              <div class="line">Of all the days of the year, upon that day:</div>
                              <div class="line">For I had then laid wormwood to my dug,</div>
                              <div class="line">Sitting in the sun under the dove-house wall;</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord and you were then at Mantua:--</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, I do bear a brain:--but, as I said,</div>
                              <div class="line">When it did taste the wormwood on the nipple</div>
                              <div class="line">Of my dug and felt it bitter, pretty fool,</div>
                              <div class="line">To see it tetchy and fall out with the dug!</div>
                              <div class="line">Shake quoth the dove-house: 'twas no need, I trow,</div>
                              <div class="line">To bid me trudge:</div>
                              <div class="line">And since that time it is eleven years;</div>
                              <div class="line">For then she could stand alone; nay, by the rood,</div>
                              <div class="line">She could have run and waddled all about;</div>
                              <div class="line">For even the day before, she broke her brow:</div>
                              <div class="line">And then my husband--God be with his soul!</div>
                              <div class="line">A' was a merry man--took up the child:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Yea,' quoth he, 'dost thou fall upon thy face?</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou wilt fall backward when thou hast more wit;</div>
                              <div class="line">Wilt thou not, Jule?' and, by my holidame,</div>
                              <div class="line">The pretty wretch left crying and said 'Ay.'</div>
                              <div class="line">To see, now, how a jest shall come about!</div>
                              <div class="line">I warrant, an I should live a thousand years,</div>
                              <div class="line">I never should forget it: 'Wilt thou not, Jule?' quoth he;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, pretty fool, it stinted and said 'Ay.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">Enough of this; I pray thee, hold thy peace.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, madam: yet I cannot choose but laugh,</div>
                              <div class="line">To think it should leave crying and say 'Ay.'</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet, I warrant, it had upon its brow</div>
                              <div class="line">A bump as big as a young cockerel's stone;</div>
                              <div class="line">A parlous knock; and it cried bitterly:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Yea,' quoth my husband,'fall'st upon thy face?</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou wilt fall backward when thou comest to age;</div>
                              <div class="line">Wilt thou not, Jule?' it stinted and said 'Ay.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                              <div class="line">And stint thou too, I pray thee, nurse, say I.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace, I have done. God mark thee to his grace!</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou wast the prettiest babe that e'er I nursed:</div>
                              <div class="line">An I might live to see thee married once,</div>
                              <div class="line">I have my wish.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, that 'marry' is the very theme</div>
                              <div class="line">I came to talk of. Tell me, daughter Juliet,</div>
                              <div class="line">How stands your disposition to be married?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                              <div class="line">It is an honour that I dream not of.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                              <div class="line">An honour! were not I thine only nurse,</div>
                              <div class="line">I would say thou hadst suck'd wisdom from thy teat.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, think of marriage now; younger than you,</div>
                              <div class="line">Here in Verona, ladies of esteem,</div>
                              <div class="line">Are made already mothers: by my count,</div>
                              <div class="line">I was your mother much upon these years</div>
                              <div class="line">That you are now a maid. Thus then in brief:</div>
                              <div class="line">The valiant Paris seeks you for his love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                              <div class="line">A man, young lady! lady, such a man</div>
                              <div class="line">As all the world--why, he's a man of wax.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">Verona's summer hath not such a flower.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, he's a flower; in faith, a very flower.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">What say you? can you love the gentleman?</div>
                              <div class="line">This night you shall behold him at our feast;</div>
                              <div class="line">Read o'er the volume of young Paris' face,</div>
                              <div class="line">And find delight writ there with beauty's pen;</div>
                              <div class="line">Examine every married lineament,</div>
                              <div class="line">And see how one another lends content</div>
                              <div class="line">And what obscured in this fair volume lies</div>
                              <div class="line">Find written in the margent of his eyes.</div>
                              <div class="line">This precious book of love, this unbound lover,</div>
                              <div class="line">To beautify him, only lacks a cover:</div>
                              <div class="line">The fish lives in the sea, and 'tis much pride</div>
                              <div class="line">For fair without the fair within to hide:</div>
                              <div class="line">That book in many's eyes doth share the glory,</div>
                              <div class="line">That in gold clasps locks in the golden story;</div>
                              <div class="line">So shall you share all that he doth possess,</div>
                              <div class="line">By having him, making yourself no less.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                              <div class="line">No less! nay, bigger; women grow by men.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak briefly, can you like of Paris' love?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll look to like, if looking liking move:</div>
                              <div class="line">But no more deep will I endart mine eye</div>
                              <div class="line">Than your consent gives strength to make it fly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter a Servant</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, the guests are come, supper served up, you</div>
                              <div class="line">called, my young lady asked for, the nurse cursed in</div>
                              <div class="line">the pantry, and every thing in extremity. I must</div>
                              <div class="line">hence to wait; I beseech you, follow straight.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">We follow thee.</div>
                              <p>Exit Servant</p>
                              <div class="line">Juliet, the county stays.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, girl, seek happy nights to happy days.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.6">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>5. SCENE IV.  A street.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter ROMEO, MERCUTIO, BENVOLIO, with five or six
Maskers, Torch-bearers, and others</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">What, shall this speech be spoke for our excuse?</div>
                              <div class="line">Or shall we on without a apology?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">The date is out of such prolixity:</div>
                              <div class="line">We'll have no Cupid hoodwink'd with a scarf,</div>
                              <div class="line">Bearing a Tartar's painted bow of lath,</div>
                              <div class="line">Scaring the ladies like a crow-keeper;</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor no without-book prologue, faintly spoke</div>
                              <div class="line">After the prompter, for our entrance:</div>
                              <div class="line">But let them measure us by what they will;</div>
                              <div class="line">We'll measure them a measure, and be gone.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me a torch: I am not for this ambling;</div>
                              <div class="line">Being but heavy, I will bear the light.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MERCUTIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, gentle Romeo, we must have you dance.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Not I, believe me: you have dancing shoes</div>
                              <div class="line">With nimble soles: I have a soul of lead</div>
                              <div class="line">So stakes me to the ground I cannot move.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MERCUTIO</div>
                              <div class="line">You are a lover; borrow Cupid's wings,</div>
                              <div class="line">And soar with them above a common bound.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">I am too sore enpierced with his shaft</div>
                              <div class="line">To soar with his light feathers, and so bound,</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot bound a pitch above dull woe:</div>
                              <div class="line">Under love's heavy burden do I sink.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MERCUTIO</div>
                              <div class="line">And, to sink in it, should you burden love;</div>
                              <div class="line">Too great oppression for a tender thing.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Is love a tender thing? it is too rough,</div>
                              <div class="line">Too rude, too boisterous, and it pricks like thorn.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MERCUTIO</div>
                              <div class="line">If love be rough with you, be rough with love;</div>
                              <div class="line">Prick love for pricking, and you beat love down.</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me a case to put my visage in:</div>
                              <div class="line">A visor for a visor! what care I</div>
                              <div class="line">What curious eye doth quote deformities?</div>
                              <div class="line">Here are the beetle brows shall blush for me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, knock and enter; and no sooner in,</div>
                              <div class="line">But every man betake him to his legs.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">A torch for me: let wantons light of heart</div>
                              <div class="line">Tickle the senseless rushes with their heels,</div>
                              <div class="line">For I am proverb'd with a grandsire phrase;</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll be a candle-holder, and look on.</div>
                              <div class="line">The game was ne'er so fair, and I am done.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MERCUTIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Tut, dun's the mouse, the constable's own word:</div>
                              <div class="line">If thou art dun, we'll draw thee from the mire</div>
                              <div class="line">Of this sir-reverence love, wherein thou stick'st</div>
                              <div class="line">Up to the ears. Come, we burn daylight, ho!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, that's not so.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MERCUTIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I mean, sir, in delay</div>
                              <div class="line">We waste our lights in vain, like lamps by day.</div>
                              <div class="line">Take our good meaning, for our judgment sits</div>
                              <div class="line">Five times in that ere once in our five wits.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">And we mean well in going to this mask;</div>
                              <div class="line">But 'tis no wit to go.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MERCUTIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, may one ask?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">I dream'd a dream to-night.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MERCUTIO</div>
                              <div class="line">And so did I.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, what was yours?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MERCUTIO</div>
                              <div class="line">That dreamers often lie.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">In bed asleep, while they do dream things true.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MERCUTIO</div>
                              <div class="line">O, then, I see Queen Mab hath been with you.</div>
                              <div class="line">She is the fairies' midwife, and she comes</div>
                              <div class="line">In shape no bigger than an agate-stone</div>
                              <div class="line">On the fore-finger of an alderman,</div>
                              <div class="line">Drawn with a team of little atomies</div>
                              <div class="line">Athwart men's noses as they lie asleep;</div>
                              <div class="line">Her wagon-spokes made of long spiders' legs,</div>
                              <div class="line">The cover of the wings of grasshoppers,</div>
                              <div class="line">The traces of the smallest spider's web,</div>
                              <div class="line">The collars of the moonshine's watery beams,</div>
                              <div class="line">Her whip of cricket's bone, the lash of film,</div>
                              <div class="line">Her wagoner a small grey-coated gnat,</div>
                              <div class="line">Not so big as a round little worm</div>
                              <div class="line">Prick'd from the lazy finger of a maid;</div>
                              <div class="line">Her chariot is an empty hazel-nut</div>
                              <div class="line">Made by the joiner squirrel or old grub,</div>
                              <div class="line">Time out o' mind the fairies' coachmakers.</div>
                              <div class="line">And in this state she gallops night by night</div>
                              <div class="line">Through lovers' brains, and then they dream of love;</div>
                              <div class="line">O'er courtiers' knees, that dream on court'sies straight,</div>
                              <div class="line">O'er lawyers' fingers, who straight dream on fees,</div>
                              <div class="line">O'er ladies ' lips, who straight on kisses dream,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which oft the angry Mab with blisters plagues,</div>
                              <div class="line">Because their breaths with sweetmeats tainted are:</div>
                              <div class="line">Sometime she gallops o'er a courtier's nose,</div>
                              <div class="line">And then dreams he of smelling out a suit;</div>
                              <div class="line">And sometime comes she with a tithe-pig's tail</div>
                              <div class="line">Tickling a parson's nose as a' lies asleep,</div>
                              <div class="line">Then dreams, he of another benefice:</div>
                              <div class="line">Sometime she driveth o'er a soldier's neck,</div>
                              <div class="line">And then dreams he of cutting foreign throats,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of breaches, ambuscadoes, Spanish blades,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of healths five-fathom deep; and then anon</div>
                              <div class="line">Drums in his ear, at which he starts and wakes,</div>
                              <div class="line">And being thus frighted swears a prayer or two</div>
                              <div class="line">And sleeps again. This is that very Mab</div>
                              <div class="line">That plats the manes of horses in the night,</div>
                              <div class="line">And bakes the elflocks in foul sluttish hairs,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which once untangled, much misfortune bodes:</div>
                              <div class="line">This is the hag, when maids lie on their backs,</div>
                              <div class="line">That presses them and learns them first to bear,</div>
                              <div class="line">Making them women of good carriage:</div>
                              <div class="line">This is she--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace, peace, Mercutio, peace!</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou talk'st of nothing.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MERCUTIO</div>
                              <div class="line">True, I talk of dreams,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which are the children of an idle brain,</div>
                              <div class="line">Begot of nothing but vain fantasy,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which is as thin of substance as the air</div>
                              <div class="line">And more inconstant than the wind, who wooes</div>
                              <div class="line">Even now the frozen bosom of the north,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, being anger'd, puffs away from thence,</div>
                              <div class="line">Turning his face to the dew-dropping south.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BENVOLIO</div>
                              <div class="line">This wind, you talk of, blows us from ourselves;</div>
                              <div class="line">Supper is done, and we shall come too late.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">I fear, too early: for my mind misgives</div>
                              <div class="line">Some consequence yet hanging in the stars</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall bitterly begin his fearful date</div>
                              <div class="line">With this night's revels and expire the term</div>
                              <div class="line">Of a despised life closed in my breast</div>
                              <div class="line">By some vile forfeit of untimely death.</div>
                              <div class="line">But He, that hath the steerage of my course,</div>
                              <div class="line">Direct my sail! On, lusty gentlemen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
