                              <div class="line">Sleep for a week; for the next night, I warrant,</div>
                              <div class="line">The County Paris hath set up his rest,</div>
                              <div class="line">That you shall rest but little. God forgive me,</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, and amen, how sound is she asleep!</div>
                              <div class="line">I must needs wake her. Madam, madam, madam!</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, let the county take you in your bed;</div>
                              <div class="line">He'll fright you up, i' faith. Will it not be?</div>
                              <p>Undraws the curtains</p>
                              <div class="line">What, dress'd! and in your clothes! and down again!</div>
                              <div class="line">I must needs wake you; Lady! lady! lady!</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, alas! Help, help! my lady's dead!</div>
                              <div class="line">O, well-a-day, that ever I was born!</div>
                              <div class="line">Some aqua vitae, ho! My lord! my lady!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter LADY CAPULET</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">What noise is here?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                              <div class="line">O lamentable day!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">What is the matter?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                              <div class="line">Look, look! O heavy day!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">O me, O me! My child, my only life,</div>
                              <div class="line">Revive, look up, or I will die with thee!</div>
                              <div class="line">Help, help! Call help.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter CAPULET</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">For shame, bring Juliet forth; her lord is come.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                              <div class="line">She's dead, deceased, she's dead; alack the day!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">Alack the day, she's dead, she's dead, she's dead!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">Ha! let me see her: out, alas! she's cold:</div>
                              <div class="line">Her blood is settled, and her joints are stiff;</div>
                              <div class="line">Life and these lips have long been separated:</div>
                              <div class="line">Death lies on her like an untimely frost</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon the sweetest flower of all the field.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                              <div class="line">O lamentable day!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">O woful time!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">Death, that hath ta'en her hence to make me wail,</div>
                              <div class="line">Ties up my tongue, and will not let me speak.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter FRIAR LAURENCE and PARIS, with Musicians</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, is the bride ready to go to church?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">Ready to go, but never to return.</div>
                              <div class="line">O son! the night before thy wedding-day</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath Death lain with thy wife. There she lies,</div>
                              <div class="line">Flower as she was, deflowered by him.</div>
                              <div class="line">Death is my son-in-law, Death is my heir;</div>
                              <div class="line">My daughter he hath wedded: I will die,</div>
                              <div class="line">And leave him all; life, living, all is Death's.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                              <div class="line">Have I thought long to see this morning's face,</div>
                              <div class="line">And doth it give me such a sight as this?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">Accursed, unhappy, wretched, hateful day!</div>
                              <div class="line">Most miserable hour that e'er time saw</div>
                              <div class="line">In lasting labour of his pilgrimage!</div>
                              <div class="line">But one, poor one, one poor and loving child,</div>
                              <div class="line">But one thing to rejoice and solace in,</div>
                              <div class="line">And cruel death hath catch'd it from my sight!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                              <div class="line">O woe! O woful, woful, woful day!</div>
                              <div class="line">Most lamentable day, most woful day,</div>
                              <div class="line">That ever, ever, I did yet behold!</div>
                              <div class="line">O day! O day! O day! O hateful day!</div>
                              <div class="line">Never was seen so black a day as this:</div>
                              <div class="line">O woful day, O woful day!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                              <div class="line">Beguiled, divorced, wronged, spited, slain!</div>
                              <div class="line">Most detestable death, by thee beguil'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">By cruel cruel thee quite overthrown!</div>
                              <div class="line">O love! O life! not life, but love in death!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">Despised, distressed, hated, martyr'd, kill'd!</div>
                              <div class="line">Uncomfortable time, why camest thou now</div>
                              <div class="line">To murder, murder our solemnity?</div>
                              <div class="line">O child! O child! my soul, and not my child!</div>
                              <div class="line">Dead art thou! Alack! my child is dead;</div>
                              <div class="line">And with my child my joys are buried.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace, ho, for shame! confusion's cure lives not</div>
                              <div class="line">In these confusions. Heaven and yourself</div>
                              <div class="line">Had part in this fair maid; now heaven hath all,</div>
                              <div class="line">And all the better is it for the maid:</div>
                              <div class="line">Your part in her you could not keep from death,</div>
                              <div class="line">But heaven keeps his part in eternal life.</div>
                              <div class="line">The most you sought was her promotion;</div>
                              <div class="line">For 'twas your heaven she should be advanced:</div>
                              <div class="line">And weep ye now, seeing she is advanced</div>
                              <div class="line">Above the clouds, as high as heaven itself?</div>
                              <div class="line">O, in this love, you love your child so ill,</div>
                              <div class="line">That you run mad, seeing that she is well:</div>
                              <div class="line">She's not well married that lives married long;</div>
                              <div class="line">But she's best married that dies married young.</div>
                              <div class="line">Dry up your tears, and stick your rosemary</div>
                              <div class="line">On this fair corse; and, as the custom is,</div>
                              <div class="line">In all her best array bear her to church:</div>
                              <div class="line">For though fond nature bids us an lament,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet nature's tears are reason's merriment.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">All things that we ordained festival,</div>
                              <div class="line">Turn from their office to black funeral;</div>
                              <div class="line">Our instruments to melancholy bells,</div>
                              <div class="line">Our wedding cheer to a sad burial feast,</div>
                              <div class="line">Our solemn hymns to sullen dirges change,</div>
                              <div class="line">Our bridal flowers serve for a buried corse,</div>
                              <div class="line">And all things change them to the contrary.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, go you in; and, madam, go with him;</div>
                              <div class="line">And go, Sir Paris; every one prepare</div>
                              <div class="line">To follow this fair corse unto her grave:</div>
                              <div class="line">The heavens do lour upon you for some ill;</div>
                              <div class="line">Move them no more by crossing their high will.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt CAPULET, LADY CAPULET, PARIS, and FRIAR LAURENCE</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Musician</div>
                              <div class="line">Faith, we may put up our pipes, and be gone.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Nurse</div>
                              <div class="line">Honest goodfellows, ah, put up, put up;</div>
                              <div class="line">For, well you know, this is a pitiful case.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Musician</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, by my troth, the case may be amended.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter PETER</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PETER</div>
                              <div class="line">Musicians, O, musicians, 'Heart's ease, Heart's</div>
                              <div class="line">ease:' O, an you will have me live, play 'Heart's ease.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Musician</div>
                              <div class="line">Why 'Heart's ease?'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PETER</div>
                              <div class="line">O, musicians, because my heart itself plays 'My</div>
                              <div class="line">heart is full of woe:' O, play me some merry dump,</div>
                              <div class="line">to comfort me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Musician</div>
                              <div class="line">Not a dump we; 'tis no time to play now.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PETER</div>
                              <div class="line">You will not, then?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Musician</div>
                              <div class="line">No.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PETER</div>
                              <div class="line">I will then give it you soundly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Musician</div>
                              <div class="line">What will you give us?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PETER</div>
                              <div class="line">No money, on my faith, but the gleek;</div>
                              <div class="line">I will give you the minstrel.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Musician</div>
                              <div class="line">Then I will give you the serving-creature.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PETER</div>
                              <div class="line">Then will I lay the serving-creature's dagger on</div>
                              <div class="line">your pate. I will carry no crotchets: I'll re you,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll fa you; do you note me?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Musician</div>
                              <div class="line">An you re us and fa us, you note us.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Musician</div>
                              <div class="line">Pray you, put up your dagger, and put out your wit.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PETER</div>
                              <div class="line">Then have at you with my wit! I will dry-beat you</div>
                              <div class="line">with an iron wit, and put up my iron dagger. Answer</div>
                              <div class="line">me like men:</div>
                              <div class="line">'When griping grief the heart doth wound,</div>
                              <div class="line">And doleful dumps the mind oppress,</div>
                              <div class="line">Then music with her silver sound'--</div>
                              <div class="line">why 'silver sound'? why 'music with her silver</div>
                              <div class="line">sound'? What say you, Simon Catling?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Musician</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, sir, because silver hath a sweet sound.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PETER</div>
                              <div class="line">Pretty! What say you, Hugh Rebeck?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Musician</div>
                              <div class="line">I say 'silver sound,' because musicians sound for silver.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PETER</div>
                              <div class="line">Pretty too! What say you, James Soundpost?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Musician</div>
                              <div class="line">Faith, I know not what to say.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PETER</div>
                              <div class="line">O, I cry you mercy; you are the singer: I will say</div>
                              <div class="line">for you. It is 'music with her silver sound,'</div>
                              <div class="line">because musicians have no gold for sounding:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Then music with her silver sound</div>
                              <div class="line">With speedy help doth lend redress.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Musician</div>
                              <div class="line">What a pestilent knave is this same!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Musician</div>
                              <div class="line">Hang him, Jack! Come, we'll in here; tarry for the</div>
                              <div class="line">mourners, and stay dinner.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.7">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 5. ACT V</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  Mantua. A street.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  Friar Laurence's cell.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  Mantua. A street.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter ROMEO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">If I may trust the flattering truth of sleep,</div>
                              <div class="line">My dreams presage some joyful news at hand:</div>
                              <div class="line">My bosom's lord sits lightly in his throne;</div>
                              <div class="line">And all this day an unaccustom'd spirit</div>
                              <div class="line">Lifts me above the ground with cheerful thoughts.</div>
                              <div class="line">I dreamt my lady came and found me dead--</div>
                              <div class="line">Strange dream, that gives a dead man leave</div>
                              <div class="line">to think!--</div>
                              <div class="line">And breathed such life with kisses in my lips,</div>
                              <div class="line">That I revived, and was an emperor.</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah me! how sweet is love itself possess'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">When but love's shadows are so rich in joy!</div>
                              <p>Enter BALTHASAR, booted</p>
                              <div class="line">News from Verona!--How now, Balthasar!</div>
                              <div class="line">Dost thou not bring me letters from the friar?</div>
                              <div class="line">How doth my lady? Is my father well?</div>
                              <div class="line">How fares my Juliet? that I ask again;</div>
                              <div class="line">For nothing can be ill, if she be well.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Then she is well, and nothing can be ill:</div>
                              <div class="line">Her body sleeps in Capel's monument,</div>
                              <div class="line">And her immortal part with angels lives.</div>
                              <div class="line">I saw her laid low in her kindred's vault,</div>
                              <div class="line">And presently took post to tell it you:</div>
                              <div class="line">O, pardon me for bringing these ill news,</div>
                              <div class="line">Since you did leave it for my office, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Is it even so? then I defy you, stars!</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou know'st my lodging: get me ink and paper,</div>
                              <div class="line">And hire post-horses; I will hence to-night.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                              <div class="line">I do beseech you, sir, have patience:</div>
                              <div class="line">Your looks are pale and wild, and do import</div>
                              <div class="line">Some misadventure.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Tush, thou art deceived:</div>
                              <div class="line">Leave me, and do the thing I bid thee do.</div>
                              <div class="line">Hast thou no letters to me from the friar?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                              <div class="line">No, my good lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">No matter: get thee gone,</div>
                              <div class="line">And hire those horses; I'll be with thee straight.</div>
                              <p>Exit BALTHASAR</p>
                              <div class="line">Well, Juliet, I will lie with thee to-night.</div>
                              <div class="line">Let's see for means: O mischief, thou art swift</div>
                              <div class="line">To enter in the thoughts of desperate men!</div>
                              <div class="line">I do remember an apothecary,--</div>
                              <div class="line">And hereabouts he dwells,--which late I noted</div>
                              <div class="line">In tatter'd weeds, with overwhelming brows,</div>
                              <div class="line">Culling of simples; meagre were his looks,</div>
                              <div class="line">Sharp misery had worn him to the bones:</div>
                              <div class="line">And in his needy shop a tortoise hung,</div>
                              <div class="line">An alligator stuff'd, and other skins</div>
                              <div class="line">Of ill-shaped fishes; and about his shelves</div>
                              <div class="line">A beggarly account of empty boxes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Green earthen pots, bladders and musty seeds,</div>
                              <div class="line">Remnants of packthread and old cakes of roses,</div>
                              <div class="line">Were thinly scatter'd, to make up a show.</div>
                              <div class="line">Noting this penury, to myself I said</div>
                              <div class="line">'An if a man did need a poison now,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose sale is present death in Mantua,</div>
                              <div class="line">Here lives a caitiff wretch would sell it him.'</div>
                              <div class="line">O, this same thought did but forerun my need;</div>
                              <div class="line">And this same needy man must sell it me.</div>
                              <div class="line">As I remember, this should be the house.</div>
                              <div class="line">Being holiday, the beggar's shop is shut.</div>
                              <div class="line">What, ho! apothecary!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter Apothecary</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Apothecary</div>
                              <div class="line">Who calls so loud?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Come hither, man. I see that thou art poor:</div>
                              <div class="line">Hold, there is forty ducats: let me have</div>
                              <div class="line">A dram of poison, such soon-speeding gear</div>
                              <div class="line">As will disperse itself through all the veins</div>
                              <div class="line">That the life-weary taker may fall dead</div>
                              <div class="line">And that the trunk may be discharged of breath</div>
                              <div class="line">As violently as hasty powder fired</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth hurry from the fatal cannon's womb.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Apothecary</div>
                              <div class="line">Such mortal drugs I have; but Mantua's law</div>
                              <div class="line">Is death to any he that utters them.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Art thou so bare and full of wretchedness,</div>
                              <div class="line">And fear'st to die? famine is in thy cheeks,</div>
                              <div class="line">Need and oppression starveth in thine eyes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Contempt and beggary hangs upon thy back;</div>
                              <div class="line">The world is not thy friend nor the world's law;</div>
                              <div class="line">The world affords no law to make thee rich;</div>
                              <div class="line">Then be not poor, but break it, and take this.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Apothecary</div>
                              <div class="line">My poverty, but not my will, consents.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">I pay thy poverty, and not thy will.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Apothecary</div>
                              <div class="line">Put this in any liquid thing you will,</div>
                              <div class="line">And drink it off; and, if you had the strength</div>
                              <div class="line">Of twenty men, it would dispatch you straight.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">There is thy gold, worse poison to men's souls,</div>
                              <div class="line">Doing more murders in this loathsome world,</div>
                              <div class="line">Than these poor compounds that thou mayst not sell.</div>
                              <div class="line">I sell thee poison; thou hast sold me none.</div>
                              <div class="line">Farewell: buy food, and get thyself in flesh.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, cordial and not poison, go with me</div>
                              <div class="line">To Juliet's grave; for there must I use thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  Friar Laurence's cell.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter FRIAR JOHN</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FRIAR JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Holy Franciscan friar! brother, ho!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter FRIAR LAURENCE</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">This same should be the voice of Friar John.</div>
                              <div class="line">Welcome from Mantua: what says Romeo?</div>
                              <div class="line">Or, if his mind be writ, give me his letter.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FRIAR JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Going to find a bare-foot brother out</div>
                              <div class="line">One of our order, to associate me,</div>
                              <div class="line">Here in this city visiting the sick,</div>
                              <div class="line">And finding him, the searchers of the town,</div>
                              <div class="line">Suspecting that we both were in a house</div>
                              <div class="line">Where the infectious pestilence did reign,</div>
                              <div class="line">Seal'd up the doors, and would not let us forth;</div>
                              <div class="line">So that my speed to Mantua there was stay'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Who bare my letter, then, to Romeo?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FRIAR JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">I could not send it,--here it is again,--</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor get a messenger to bring it thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">So fearful were they of infection.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Unhappy fortune! by my brotherhood,</div>
                              <div class="line">The letter was not nice but full of charge</div>
                              <div class="line">Of dear import, and the neglecting it</div>
                              <div class="line">May do much danger. Friar John, go hence;</div>
                              <div class="line">Get me an iron crow, and bring it straight</div>
                              <div class="line">Unto my cell.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FRIAR JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Brother, I'll go and bring it thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Now must I to the monument alone;</div>
                              <div class="line">Within three hours will fair Juliet wake:</div>
                              <div class="line">She will beshrew me much that Romeo</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath had no notice of these accidents;</div>
                              <div class="line">But I will write again to Mantua,</div>
                              <div class="line">And keep her at my cell till Romeo come;</div>
                              <div class="line">Poor living corse, closed in a dead man's tomb!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter PARIS, and his Page bearing flowers and a torch</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me thy torch, boy: hence, and stand aloof:</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet put it out, for I would not be seen.</div>
                              <div class="line">Under yond yew-trees lay thee all along,</div>
                              <div class="line">Holding thine ear close to the hollow ground;</div>
                              <div class="line">So shall no foot upon the churchyard tread,</div>
                              <div class="line">Being loose, unfirm, with digging up of graves,</div>
                              <div class="line">But thou shalt hear it: whistle then to me,</div>
                              <div class="line">As signal that thou hear'st something approach.</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me those flowers. Do as I bid thee, go.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PAGE</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  I am almost afraid to stand alone</div>
                              <div class="line">Here in the churchyard; yet I will adventure.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Retires</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet flower, with flowers thy bridal bed I strew,--</div>
                              <div class="line">O woe! thy canopy is dust and stones;--</div>
                              <div class="line">Which with sweet water nightly I will dew,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or, wanting that, with tears distill'd by moans:</div>
                              <div class="line">The obsequies that I for thee will keep</div>
                              <div class="line">Nightly shall be to strew thy grave and weep.</div>
                              <p>The Page whistles</p>
                              <div class="line">The boy gives warning something doth approach.</div>
                              <div class="line">What cursed foot wanders this way to-night,</div>
                              <div class="line">To cross my obsequies and true love's rite?</div>
                              <div class="line">What with a torch! muffle me, night, awhile.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Retires</p>
                        <p>Enter ROMEO and BALTHASAR, with a torch,
mattock, &c</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me that mattock and the wrenching iron.</div>
                              <div class="line">Hold, take this letter; early in the morning</div>
                              <div class="line">See thou deliver it to my lord and father.</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me the light: upon thy life, I charge thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whate'er thou hear'st or seest, stand all aloof,</div>
                              <div class="line">And do not interrupt me in my course.</div>
                              <div class="line">Why I descend into this bed of death,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is partly to behold my lady's face;</div>
                              <div class="line">But chiefly to take thence from her dead finger</div>
                              <div class="line">A precious ring, a ring that I must use</div>
                              <div class="line">In dear employment: therefore hence, be gone:</div>
                              <div class="line">But if thou, jealous, dost return to pry</div>
                              <div class="line">In what I further shall intend to do,</div>
                              <div class="line">By heaven, I will tear thee joint by joint</div>
                              <div class="line">And strew this hungry churchyard with thy limbs:</div>
                              <div class="line">The time and my intents are savage-wild,</div>
                              <div class="line">More fierce and more inexorable far</div>
                              <div class="line">Than empty tigers or the roaring sea.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                              <div class="line">I will be gone, sir, and not trouble you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">So shalt thou show me friendship. Take thou that:</div>
                              <div class="line">Live, and be prosperous: and farewell, good fellow.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  For all this same, I'll hide me hereabout:</div>
                              <div class="line">His looks I fear, and his intents I doubt.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Retires</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou detestable maw, thou womb of death,</div>
                              <div class="line">Gorged with the dearest morsel of the earth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thus I enforce thy rotten jaws to open,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, in despite, I'll cram thee with more food!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Opens the tomb</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                              <div class="line">This is that banish'd haughty Montague,</div>
                              <div class="line">That murder'd my love's cousin, with which grief,</div>
                              <div class="line">It is supposed, the fair creature died;</div>
                              <div class="line">And here is come to do some villanous shame</div>
                              <div class="line">To the dead bodies: I will apprehend him.</div>
                              <p>Comes forward</p>
                              <div class="line">Stop thy unhallow'd toil, vile Montague!</div>
                              <div class="line">Can vengeance be pursued further than death?</div>
                              <div class="line">Condemned villain, I do apprehend thee:</div>
                              <div class="line">Obey, and go with me; for thou must die.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">I must indeed; and therefore came I hither.</div>
                              <div class="line">Good gentle youth, tempt not a desperate man;</div>
                              <div class="line">Fly hence, and leave me: think upon these gone;</div>
                              <div class="line">Let them affright thee. I beseech thee, youth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Put not another sin upon my head,</div>
                              <div class="line">By urging me to fury: O, be gone!</div>
                              <div class="line">By heaven, I love thee better than myself;</div>
                              <div class="line">For I come hither arm'd against myself:</div>
                              <div class="line">Stay not, be gone; live, and hereafter say,</div>
                              <div class="line">A madman's mercy bade thee run away.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                              <div class="line">I do defy thy conjurations,</div>
                              <div class="line">And apprehend thee for a felon here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">Wilt thou provoke me? then have at thee, boy!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>They fight</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PAGE</div>
                              <div class="line">O Lord, they fight! I will go call the watch.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PARIS</div>
                              <div class="line">O, I am slain!</div>
                              <p>Falls</p>
                              <div class="line">If thou be merciful,</div>
                              <div class="line">Open the tomb, lay me with Juliet.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Dies</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ROMEO</div>
                              <div class="line">In faith, I will. Let me peruse this face.</div>
                              <div class="line">Mercutio's kinsman, noble County Paris!</div>
                              <div class="line">What said my man, when my betossed soul</div>
                              <div class="line">Did not attend him as we rode? I think</div>
                              <div class="line">He told me Paris should have married Juliet:</div>
                              <div class="line">Said he not so? or did I dream it so?</div>
                              <div class="line">Or am I mad, hearing him talk of Juliet,</div>
                              <div class="line">To think it was so? O, give me thy hand,</div>
                              <div class="line">One writ with me in sour misfortune's book!</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll bury thee in a triumphant grave;</div>
                              <div class="line">A grave? O no! a lantern, slaughter'd youth,</div>
                              <div class="line">For here lies Juliet, and her beauty makes</div>
                              <div class="line">This vault a feasting presence full of light.</div>
                              <div class="line">Death, lie thou there, by a dead man interr'd.</div>
                              <p>Laying PARIS in the tomb</p>
                              <div class="line">How oft when men are at the point of death</div>
                              <div class="line">Have they been merry! which their keepers call</div>
                              <div class="line">A lightning before death: O, how may I</div>
                              <div class="line">Call this a lightning? O my love! my wife!</div>
                              <div class="line">Death, that hath suck'd the honey of thy breath,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath had no power yet upon thy beauty:</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou art not conquer'd; beauty's ensign yet</div>
                              <div class="line">Is crimson in thy lips and in thy cheeks,</div>
                              <div class="line">And death's pale flag is not advanced there.</div>
                              <div class="line">Tybalt, liest thou there in thy bloody sheet?</div>
                              <div class="line">O, what more favour can I do to thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">Than with that hand that cut thy youth in twain</div>
                              <div class="line">To sunder his that was thine enemy?</div>
                              <div class="line">Forgive me, cousin! Ah, dear Juliet,</div>
                              <div class="line">Why art thou yet so fair? shall I believe</div>
                              <div class="line">That unsubstantial death is amorous,</div>
                              <div class="line">And that the lean abhorred monster keeps</div>
                              <div class="line">Thee here in dark to be his paramour?</div>
                              <div class="line">For fear of that, I still will stay with thee;</div>
                              <div class="line">And never from this palace of dim night</div>
                              <div class="line">Depart again: here, here will I remain</div>
                              <div class="line">With worms that are thy chamber-maids; O, here</div>
                              <div class="line">Will I set up my everlasting rest,</div>
                              <div class="line">And shake the yoke of inauspicious stars</div>
                              <div class="line">From this world-wearied flesh. Eyes, look your last!</div>
                              <div class="line">Arms, take your last embrace! and, lips, O you</div>
                              <div class="line">The doors of breath, seal with a righteous kiss</div>
                              <div class="line">A dateless bargain to engrossing death!</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, bitter conduct, come, unsavoury guide!</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou desperate pilot, now at once run on</div>
                              <div class="line">The dashing rocks thy sea-sick weary bark!</div>
                              <div class="line">Here's to my love!</div>
                              <p>Drinks</p>
                              <div class="line">O true apothecary!</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy drugs are quick. Thus with a kiss I die.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Dies</p>
                        <p>Enter, at the other end of the churchyard, FRIAR
LAURENCE, with a lantern, crow, and spade</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Saint Francis be my speed! how oft to-night</div>
                              <div class="line">Have my old feet stumbled at graves! Who's there?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Here's one, a friend, and one that knows you well.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Bliss be upon you! Tell me, good my friend,</div>
                              <div class="line">What torch is yond, that vainly lends his light</div>
                              <div class="line">To grubs and eyeless skulls? as I discern,</div>
                              <div class="line">It burneth in the Capel's monument.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                              <div class="line">It doth so, holy sir; and there's my master,</div>
                              <div class="line">One that you love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Who is it?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Romeo.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">How long hath he been there?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Full half an hour.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Go with me to the vault.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                              <div class="line">I dare not, sir</div>
                              <div class="line">My master knows not but I am gone hence;</div>
                              <div class="line">And fearfully did menace me with death,</div>
                              <div class="line">If I did stay to look on his intents.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Stay, then; I'll go alone. Fear comes upon me:</div>
                              <div class="line">O, much I fear some ill unlucky thing.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                              <div class="line">As I did sleep under this yew-tree here,</div>
                              <div class="line">I dreamt my master and another fought,</div>
                              <div class="line">And that my master slew him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Romeo!</div>
                              <p>Advances</p>
                              <div class="line">Alack, alack, what blood is this, which stains</div>
                              <div class="line">The stony entrance of this sepulchre?</div>
                              <div class="line">What mean these masterless and gory swords</div>
                              <div class="line">To lie discolour'd by this place of peace?</div>
                              <p>Enters the tomb</p>
                              <div class="line">Romeo! O, pale! Who else? what, Paris too?</div>
                              <div class="line">And steep'd in blood? Ah, what an unkind hour</div>
                              <div class="line">Is guilty of this lamentable chance!</div>
                              <div class="line">The lady stirs.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>JULIET wakes</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                              <div class="line">O comfortable friar! where is my lord?</div>
                              <div class="line">I do remember well where I should be,</div>
                              <div class="line">And there I am. Where is my Romeo?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Noise within</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">I hear some noise. Lady, come from that nest</div>
                              <div class="line">Of death, contagion, and unnatural sleep:</div>
                              <div class="line">A greater power than we can contradict</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath thwarted our intents. Come, come away.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy husband in thy bosom there lies dead;</div>
                              <div class="line">And Paris too. Come, I'll dispose of thee</div>
                              <div class="line">Among a sisterhood of holy nuns:</div>
                              <div class="line">Stay not to question, for the watch is coming;</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, go, good Juliet,</div>
                              <p>Noise again</p>
                              <div class="line">I dare no longer stay.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, get thee hence, for I will not away.</div>
                              <p>Exit FRIAR LAURENCE</p>
                              <div class="line">What's here? a cup, closed in my true love's hand?</div>
                              <div class="line">Poison, I see, hath been his timeless end:</div>
                              <div class="line">O churl! drunk all, and left no friendly drop</div>
                              <div class="line">To help me after? I will kiss thy lips;</div>
                              <div class="line">Haply some poison yet doth hang on them,</div>
                              <div class="line">To make die with a restorative.</div>
                              <p>Kisses him</p>
                              <div class="line">Thy lips are warm.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Watchman</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Within</span>  Lead, boy: which way?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JULIET</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, noise? then I'll be brief. O happy dagger!</div>
                              <p>Snatching ROMEO's dagger</p>
                              <div class="line">This is thy sheath;</div>
                              <p>Stabs herself</p>
                              <div class="line">there rust, and let me die.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Falls on ROMEO's body, and dies</p>
                        <p>Enter Watch, with the Page of PARIS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PAGE</div>
                              <div class="line">This is the place; there, where the torch doth burn.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Watchman</div>
                              <div class="line">The ground is bloody; search about the churchyard:</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, some of you, whoe'er you find attach.</div>
                              <div class="line">Pitiful sight! here lies the county slain,</div>
                              <div class="line">And Juliet bleeding, warm, and newly dead,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who here hath lain these two days buried.</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, tell the prince: run to the Capulets:</div>
                              <div class="line">Raise up the Montagues: some others search:</div>
                              <div class="line">We see the ground whereon these woes do lie;</div>
                              <div class="line">But the true ground of all these piteous woes</div>
                              <div class="line">We cannot without circumstance descry.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter some of the Watch, with BALTHASAR</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Watchman</div>
                              <div class="line">Here's Romeo's man; we found him in the churchyard.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Watchman</div>
                              <div class="line">Hold him in safety, till the prince come hither.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter others of the Watch, with FRIAR LAURENCE</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Watchman</div>
                              <div class="line">Here is a friar, that trembles, sighs and weeps:</div>
                              <div class="line">We took this mattock and this spade from him,</div>
                              <div class="line">As he was coming from this churchyard side.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Watchman</div>
                              <div class="line">A great suspicion: stay the friar too.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter the PRINCE and Attendants</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE</div>
                              <div class="line">What misadventure is so early up,</div>
                              <div class="line">That calls our person from our morning's rest?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter CAPULET, LADY CAPULET, and others</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">What should it be, that they so shriek abroad?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">The people in the street cry Romeo,</div>
                              <div class="line">Some Juliet, and some Paris; and all run,</div>
                              <div class="line">With open outcry toward our monument.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE</div>
                              <div class="line">What fear is this which startles in our ears?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Watchman</div>
                              <div class="line">Sovereign, here lies the County Paris slain;</div>
                              <div class="line">And Romeo dead; and Juliet, dead before,</div>
                              <div class="line">Warm and new kill'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Search, seek, and know how this foul murder comes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Watchman</div>
                              <div class="line">Here is a friar, and slaughter'd Romeo's man;</div>
                              <div class="line">With instruments upon them, fit to open</div>
                              <div class="line">These dead men's tombs.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">O heavens! O wife, look how our daughter bleeds!</div>
                              <div class="line">This dagger hath mista'en--for, lo, his house</div>
                              <div class="line">Is empty on the back of Montague,--</div>
                              <div class="line">And it mis-sheathed in my daughter's bosom!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY CAPULET</div>
                              <div class="line">O me! this sight of death is as a bell,</div>
                              <div class="line">That warns my old age to a sepulchre.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter MONTAGUE and others</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, Montague; for thou art early up,</div>
                              <div class="line">To see thy son and heir more early down.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, my liege, my wife is dead to-night;</div>
                              <div class="line">Grief of my son's exile hath stopp'd her breath:</div>
                              <div class="line">What further woe conspires against mine age?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Look, and thou shalt see.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MONTAGUE</div>
                              <div class="line">O thou untaught! what manners is in this?</div>
                              <div class="line">To press before thy father to a grave?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PRINCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Seal up the mouth of outrage for a while,</div>
                              <div class="line">Till we can clear these ambiguities,</div>
                              <div class="line">And know their spring, their head, their</div>
                              <div class="line">true descent;</div>
                              <div class="line">And then will I be general of your woes,</div>
                              <div class="line">And lead you even to death: meantime forbear,</div>
                              <div class="line">And let mischance be slave to patience.</div>
                              <div class="line">Bring forth the parties of suspicion.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FRIAR LAURENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">I am the greatest, able to do least,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet most suspected, as the time and place</div>
